text: The NN for anthropogenic NN NN is now clear and convincing . The NNP ’s NN has warmed by more than 0.8 °C over the past century , and by approximately 0.6 °C in the past three decades . 1 This NN has been linked to more extreme NN conditions such as intense floods and droughts , heavier and more frequent storms , and a possible increase in frequency and intensity of the El Niño Southern Oscillation . These NNS are largely caused by JJ activities , mainly the burning of fossil fuels releasing NN dioxide ( CO2 ) that traps heat within the atmosphere . These CO2 NNS continue to rise , and NN models project the average NN NN will rise by 1.1 °C to 6.4 °C over the 21st century . 2 Since 1990 , WHO has published a series of reports on NN NN and has participated in review processes such as the Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP . These activities have outlined four key characteristics of the NN risks generated by a NN and a more variable NN . RB , these hazards are diverse , JJ and probably irreversible over JJ NN scales . They range from increased risks of extreme NN , such as fatal heat waves , floods and storms , to less dramatic but potentially more serious effects on infectious NN dynamics , shifts to JJ - term drought conditions in JJ regions , melting of glaciers that supply freshwater to JJ population centres , and NN level increases leading to salination of sources of agriculture and drinking NN . Second , the NN impacts of NN NN are potentially huge . JJ of the most important JJ killers are highly sensitive to climatic conditions . Malaria , diarrhoea and NN - NN malnutrition together VBP more than 3 CD deaths each NN . 3 Third , these risks are inequitable , in that the NN gases that VBP NN NN originate mainly from developed NNS , but the NN risks are concentrated in the poorest nations , which have contributed least to the problem . 4 Finally , JJ of the projected impacts on NN are avoidable , through a combination of JJ NN interventions in the short term , support for NN measures in NN - related sectors such as agriculture and NN management , and a JJ - term strategy to reduce JJ impacts on NN . Threats to NN are often cited to justify actions to mitigate or adapt to NN NN ; for example , NNP Nations Secretary - General Kofi Annan ’s 2006 speech in Nairobi.5 For all the attention that these issues receive , however , a comprehensive strategy to support a JJ NN response is conspicuously lacking . This strategy is urgently needed , both because the NN community has a duty to counter emerging threats , and because increased attention to NN NN offers opportunities to focus on the most disadvantaged populations ’ current needs . For example , the international community has agreed on the principle of a JJ NN NN NN fund , funded by a 2 % levy on a multibillion - dollar Clean Development Mechanism .6 However , this opportunity to strengthen JJ NN can be seized only if the NN sector knows what it should do differently because of NN NN . The development of a comprehensive strategy will take NN , but some essential principles are already clear . A JJ problem requires a strategy of international dimensions that can translate into regional and local actions . Just as NN NN ’s underlying causes are JJ , its NN implications do not respect national boundaries . Impacts in CD location , such as infectious NN epidemics or population displacements caused by droughts or rising NN levels , quickly spread across national borders . Coordinated investments in preventive measures therefore contribute to the “ JJ JJ good ” of reducing the NN of NN emergencies . The challenge is simplified somewhat by the fact that NN NN is expected to lead mainly to NNS in existing NN issues rather than to the emergence of JJ and unfamiliar diseases . An important guiding principle therefore is to increase the priority given to currently important NN burdens that are likely to be worsened by NN NN . Such a “ no regrets ” strategy will bring important JJ NN benefits under any plausible future NN conditions . NN to NN NN is essentially a matter of basic JJ NN protection . The challenges of rapid JJ , demographic and JJ NNS all call for greater emphasis on NN prevention , providing a better balance with the current focus on curative and reactive measures . The necessary preventive actions to deal with most NN - sensitive diseases are already quite clear . NN NN and other JJ stresses should VB to refocus JJ and financial commitments to implement these measures . CD emerging JJ NN threat is the decline in JJ freshwater resources , caused mainly by increasing rates of NN extraction and contamination . NN NN is expected to worsen this decline in NN quality and quantity , particularly in already dry regions such as the eastern Mediterranean and north Africa . Scaling up NN and sanitation services and providing point - of - use disinfection MD reduce the current burden of NN and ameliorate the NN impacts of decreasing NN supplies . Such interventions already have a very high cost–benefit ratio; 7 the threat of NN NN makes these preventive NN measures an RB wiser investment . As NN stresses intensify , governments MD protect NN by strengthening and enforcing their regulatory frameworks to ensure the safe use of JJ NN sources that will become increasingly important : wastewater , excreta and greywater in agriculture and aquaculture . 8 Effective surveillance and response systems are essential in managing any infectious NN , but they become RB more important under conditions of rapid NN . These conditions include climatic shifts as well as increasing rates of movement of and contact between NNS , pathogens and reservoirs . These conditions all require improved JJ NN surveillance integrated with monitoring of NN and other JJ conditions that favour NN outbreaks , including NN in wildlife and agricultural animals . NN NN RB strengthens the NN for reinforcing response systems for infectious NN outbreaks , including predefined NN plans and maintenance of the NN resources and personnel capacity necessary to mount effective responses . The impacts of current and future natural disasters MD be reduced by the NN sector defining integrated measures that address the root causes of vulnerability , and planning for effective responses after such events . For example , the NN impacts of floods can be reduced by land management policies that reduce deforestation and conserve the integrity of watersheds and coastal zones , minimize the physical impacts of mudslides and storm surges , and decrease the chances of sewage contamination . Post - flooding NN effects can be reduced by adequately planned and funded NN - sector responses , including interventions to VB outbreaks of vector - borne and NN - related diseases . Since 2000 , WHO has worked with the NNP Meteorological Organization and the UN Environment Programme to raise awareness of NN NN ’s implications for the NN sectors of highly vulnerable regions . The necessary next step is to inform and support national NN actors in taking concrete actions to protect NN . For example , WHO is addressing this NN by initiating a JJ project in 2006 on piloting approaches to protect NN in changing climates .9 In partnership with the UN Development Programme and with funding from the NNP NNP Facility , this initiative is being implemented in seven vulnerable NNS . In each , the national NN ministry chairs an intersectoral team that has identified priority NN risks from NN NN given local JJ socioeconomic and NN contexts . Through the course of the initiative , this team will RB identify , implement , monitor and refine interventions to minimize NN risks . The project will thereby support targeted interventions in these NNS , strengthen institutional capacity to address NN risks , involve an increasingly informed and engaged NN sector in adapting to NN NN , and extract lessons that are applicable to other NNS . It will RB develop monitoring mechanisms to ensure that resources are applied effectively in NN projects within the NN sector , and inform evaluations of support through this mechanism as compared with more general NN or development aid . This initiative is important preparation for the wider NN that will be necessary to meet the worldwide challenge of adapting to NN risks from NN NN . The actions described above represent “ safe investments ” for NN NN NN funds within the NN sector . However , JJ climatic risks to NN lie at least partly outside the NN sector ’s normal sphere of NN . Perhaps most critically , NN NN has the capacity to suppress agricultural yields , with the greatest risks in Africa,10 where malnutrition is already the largest single contributor to NN burdens . 11 Some of the most effective actions by NN professionals MD therefore involve supporting other sectors ’ efforts to mitigate and adapt to NN NN . Much work still needs to be done in this area , including : Ultimately , however , the JJ NN community needs to VB beyond reacting to a changing NN . A JJ preventive strategy needs to ensure the maintenance and development of healthy environments from local to JJ levels . In the JJ term , sustainable development and protection of ecosystem services are fundamentally necessary for JJ NN .13 This is not just a NN of protecting future generations , as RB in the short term development choices that protect the NN can benefit JJ NN significantly . The intersection of NN , transport , NN and NN provides an example of this . The Stern Review of the economics of NN NN argues that the JJ - term benefits of major investments to cut NN gas NNS MD vastly outweigh their costs , and that these are needed to avoid potentially catastrophic impacts on the JJ economy . 12 This coincides with a WHO assessment that feasible improvements in JJ conditions MD reduce the JJ NN burden by more than 25%.14 Much of the current burden is due to unhealthy NN and transport services . Changing these systems to reduce NN NN MD therefore RB bring significant and largely unacknowledged JJ NN gains . Improving access to JJ and active transport MD greatly reduce CO2 NNS , while RB cutting the 800 CD annual JJ deaths from outdoor air pollution , the 1.2 CD annual deaths from traffic accidents , and the 1.9 CD deaths from physical inactivity . 11 Changing the poorest communities ’ domestic NN technologies MD reduce the 1.5 CD annual indoor air pollution deaths . 15 The critical next stage for the NN community is a more direct and assertive engagement with the environment and JJ sectors to ensure that NN - supporting technological and development choices are implemented . JJ - induced NN NN is an emerging threat that rightly commands widespread policy and JJ attention . Along with other rapid NNS associated with JJ population and JJ growth , NN NN strains existing weak points in NN protection systems and calls for reconsideration of JJ NN priorities . The most effective responses are likely to be strengthening of the key functions of JJ management , surveillance and response to safeguard NN from natural disasters and NNS in infectious NN patterns , and a more pro-active approach to ensure that development decisions serve the ultimate goal of improving JJ NN .16 For the most part these are not JJ interventions but existing tools underutilized due to the “ JJ killers ” : lack of JJ commitment and of financial resources . 17 NN NN therefore demands that we intensify our efforts in preventive JJ NN and place that crucial task at the core of sustainable development . ■ • NN NN analysis : analysis graphs and plots . text: NNP NATIONS — The U.N. NN chief VBZ NN leaders must recognize there is no option except to speed - up and scale - up NN to tackle JJ NN , warning that continuing on the current path will lead to “ a catastrophe . ” Patricia Espinosa stressed in CD recent interviews with the Associated Press that NN NNS are saying there ’s still a chance to make things RB “ but the window of opportunity is closing very soon ” and the NN has 12 NNS until NN NNS reach “ a point of no return . ” That means the NN needs to accelerate all efforts to keep from reaching that level , “ and therefore all efforts are absolutely indispensable ” to cut NN NNS and keep NNS from rising , she VBD . Some top NNS VBP reaching the “ tipping point ” in 12 NNS is an oversimplification of a U.N. report last NN . Espinosa VBD NN NNS were expected to rise in the immediate future after the landmark Paris agreement was adopted in 2015 to address NN NN because the transformations needed to VB to a downward trajectory “ cannot be done overnight . ” In addition , JJ population is growing and more NNS demand more NN and resources , she VBD . “ What has become clear , however , is that if we continue to grow or to behave in a NN that this kind of trajectory is maintained we will not be able to achieve the goals of the Paris agreement , ” VBD Espinosa , who is executive secretary of the NNP Nations Framework Convention on NNP NNP . The Paris agreement called for JJ NNS to rise a maximum of 2 degrees Celsius ( 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit ) by the end of the century compared to pre-industrial times and as close as possible to 1.5 degrees Celsius ( 2.7 degrees Fahrenheit ) . The NN has already warmed 1 degree Celsius , so the goal is RB about preventing another 1 or 0.5 degrees Celsius ( 1.8 or 0.9 degrees Fahrenheit ) increase from now . A report last NN by the Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP , or IPCC , concluded that while it ’s technically possible to cap JJ NN at 1.5 degrees Celsius ( 2.7 degrees Fahrenheit ) by the end of the century , it is highly unlikely because this MD require a dramatic overhaul of the JJ economy , including a shift away from fossil fuels . Deep in the report , NNS VBP less than 2 % of 529 of their calculated possible future scenarios kept VBG below the 1.5 degree C ( 2.7 degrees F ) goal . “ What NN is showing now since Paris is that 1.5 degrees C is RB necessary because the consequences of staying at 2 degrees C are very JJ , ” Espinosa VBD . “ And secondly , it is RB showing that 1.5 degrees C is possible . It takes more effort . It takes much more JJ will . ” She VBD the IPCC NNS gave the NN 12 NNS “ to speed - up and scale - up the actions ” to cut NNS before they start spiraling out of NN . “ It does n’t mean that we VBP to wait 12 NNS and then look at it as the moment to do this , ” Espinosa VBD . “ It means that we VBP to accelerate the tipping point , and therefore all efforts are absolutely indispensable . ” The U.N. report does not VB 2030 , the date VBN , is a last chance , hard deadline for NN , as it has been interpreted in some quarters . Ebi , director of the Center for NNP and the NNP Environment at the NNP of NNP in Seattle . “ The report never VBD we only have 12 NNS left . ” Espinosa VBD in an interview Tuesday that the attention the issue is getting “ is clearly growing ” but not “ at the speed and the breadth that it should . ” Governments VBP trapped in dealing with immediate needs “ and we are not yet in a situation where we can VB we have a broad understanding that the threat to NN NN is part of those immediate needs , ” Espinosa VBD . But Espinosa VBD some NNS VBP NN NN is n’t happening , “ this is not man-made , ” and “ others are just very , very indifferent to the issue . ” “ So we have a lot of work to do to still to VB everybody on board , ” she VBD . “ We have a very JJ , JJ NN to VB . ” Espinosa stressed that the goal is “ to VB to a moment where leaders recognize that there is no option . ” “ The truth is that if we continue to produce , consume , to function as we are doing now , we VBP that we are VBG toward a catastrophe , ” she VBD , and that will mean loss of lives , serious impacts on JJ sectors of the economy , massive displacement and instability . text: Nations rich and poor must invest now to protect against destructive NN NN impacts already in the pipeline or pay an RB heavier NN later , a JJ commission led by JJ UN head Ban Ki-moon warned Tuesday . Spending $ 1.8 trillion across five key areas over the next decade MD not only VB buffer the worst impacts of JJ NN but MD generate more than $ 7 trillion in net benefits , the report from the NNP Commission on NNP argued . " JJ actions to slow NN NN are promising but insufficient , " the report concluded . " We must invest in a massive effort to adapt to conditions that are now inevitable . Mangroves -- tropical tidal NN forests -- protect , for example , against storm surges and act as nurseries for commercial fisheries , but at least a third of them globally have been uprooted for tourism or aquaculture . " NNS everywhere are experiencing the devastating impacts of NN NN , " VBD Microsoft founder NNP NNP , co-chair of the report along with NNP Bank CEO Kristalina Georgieva . NNP 's average NN NN has gone up 1C since the late 19th century , and is on track -- at current rates of CO2 NNS -- to warm another CD or three degrees by century 's end . text: The Arctic is predicted to warm faster than anywhere else in the NN this century , perhaps by as much as 7°C . These rising NNS threaten CD of the largest JJ - term stores of NN on land : permafrost . Permafrost is permanently frozen soil . The generally cold NNS in the Arctic keep soils there frozen NN - on - NN . Plants grow in the uppermost soil layers during the short summers and then decay into soil , which freezes when the winter snow arrives . Over thousands of NNS , NN has built up in these frozen soils , and they ’re now estimated to contain twice the NN currently in the atmosphere . Some of this NN is more than 50,000 NNS old , which means the plants that decomposed to produce that soil grew over 50,000 NNS ago . These soil deposits are VBN as “ Yedoma ” , which are mainly VBN in the East Siberian Arctic , but RB in parts of Alaska and Canada . As the region warms , the permafrost is thawing , and this frozen NN is being released to the atmosphere as NN dioxide and methane . Methane release is particularly worrying , as it ’s a highly potent NN gas . But a recent NN suggested that the release of methane from ancient NN sources – sometimes referred to as the Arctic methane “ bomb ” – did n’t contribute much to the NN that occurred during the last deglaciation – the period after the last NN age . This occurred 18,000 to 8,000 NNS ago , a period that NN NNS VBP intently , as it ’s the last NN JJ NNS rose by 4°C , which is roughly what is predicted for the NN by 2100 . This NN suggested to JJ that ancient methane NNS are not something we should be worried about this century . But in JJ research , we VBD that this optimism MD be misplaced . Read more : The Arctic is turning brown because of weird NN – and it MD accelerate NN NN We went to the East Siberian Arctic to compare the age of JJ forms of NN VBN in the ponds , rivers and lakes . These waters thaw during the summer and leak NN gases from the surrounding permafrost . We measured the age of the NN dioxide , methane and organic matter VBN in these waters VBG radiocarbon dating and VBD that most of the NN released to the atmosphere was overwhelmingly “ young ” . Where there was intense permafrost thaw , we VBD that the oldest methane was 4,800 NNS old , and the oldest NN dioxide was 6,000 NNS old . But over this vast Arctic landscape , the NN released was mainly from young plant organic matter . This means that the NN produced by plants growing during each summer growing season is rapidly released over the next few summers . This rapid turnover releases much more NN than the thaw of older permafrost , RB where severe thaw is occurring . So what does this mean for future NN NN ? It means that NN NNS from a NN Arctic MD not be driven by the thawing of an ancient frozen NN bomb , as it ’s often described . Instead , most NNS MD be relatively JJ NN that is produced by plants that grew fairly recently . What this shows is that the age of the NN released from the NN Arctic is less important than the amount and form it takes . Methane is 34 times more potent than NN dioxide as a NN gas over a 100 - NN timeframe . The East Siberian Arctic is a generally JJ and wet landscape , and these are conditions which produce lots of methane , as there ’s less oxygen in soils which might otherwise create NN dioxide during thaws instead . As a result , potent methane MD well dominate the NN gas NNS from the region . Since most of the NNS from the Arctic this century will likely be from “ young ” NN , we MD not VB to worry about ancient permafrost adding substantially to modern NN NN . But the Arctic will still be a huge source of NN NNS , as NN that was soil or plant matter only a few hundred NNS ago leaches to the atmosphere . That will increase as warmer NNS lengthen growing seasons in the Arctic summer . The fading spectre of an ancient methane NN bomb is cold comfort . The JJ research should urge the NN to act boldly on NN NN , to limit how much natural processes in the Arctic can contribute to the problem .

text: Swedish teen activist Greta Thunberg on Tuesday slammed JJ inaction on NN NN in front of the NN ’s top business leaders , as the annual Davos forum faced up to the perils of JJ NN while bracing for an address from US NNP Donald NNP . The 50th meeting of the NNP NNP Forum in the Swiss Alps resort got under NN seeking to meet head - on the dangers to both the environment and economy from the heating of the NN . NNP , who has repeatedly expressed scepticism about NN NN , is set to give the JJ keynote address of Davos 2020 on Tuesday morning , on the same day as his impeachment trial opens at the Senate in NNP . But before his appearance , Thunberg underlined the message that has inspired millions IN the NN — that governments are failing to wake up to the reality of NN NN . “ We are all fighting for the environment and NN . If you VBP it from a bigger perspective , basically nothing has been done . It will require much more than this . This is just the very beginning , ” she VBD . Speaking calmly and with a wry smile , Thunberg acknowledged that her campaign which began with school strikes had attracted huge attention without yet achieving NN . “ There is a difference between being heard to actually leading to something , ” she VBD . “ I am not the person who should complain about not being heard , ” she VBD to appreciative laughter . “ I am being heard all the NN . But the NN and the voice of the young NNS are not at the centre of the conversation , ” she added . The forum ’s own JJ Risks report published last week warned that “ NN NN is striking harder and more rapidly than JJ expected ” with JJ NNS on track to increase by at least three degrees Celsius ( 5.4 degrees Fahrenheit ) towards the end of the century . There are no expectations that NNP and Thunberg , who have exchanged barbs through NNP , will actually meet , but the crowded venue and intense schedule mean a chance encounter cannot be ruled out . When NNP and his entourage walked through UN headquarters last NN at the annual General Assembly , a photo of the teenager staring in apparent fury at the NN from the sidelines went viral . Tweeting as he headed to Davos , NNP appeared in bullish mood , writing he MD “ bring Good Policy and additional Hundreds of Billions of Dollars back to the NNP NNPS of NNP ! ” “ We are now NUMBER CD in the Universe , by FAR !! he added . Sustainability is the buzzword at the forum , which began in 1971 , with heel crampons handed out to participants to encourage them to walk on the icy streets rather than use cars , and the signage paint made out of seaweed . NNP ’s opposition to renewable NN , his withdrawal from the Paris NN accord negotiated under his predecessor Barack Obama , and the free hand extended to the fossil fuel industry puts him at odds with the entire thrust of the event . Business leaders attending the forum will be keen to tout their awareness on NN NN but are likely RB to be concerned by the NN of the JJ economy whose prospects , according to the IMF , have improved but remain brittle . Activists meanwhile will be pressing for much more concrete NN to fight inequality , after Oxfam issued a report outlining how the number of billionaires has doubled in the past decade and the NN ’s 22 richest men now have more wealth than all the women in Africa . Greenpeace meanwhile complained that some of the NN ’s biggest banks , insurers and pension funds have collectively invested $ 1.4 trillion in fossil fuel NNS since the Paris NN deal . Other key priorities will be exploring how to battle biodiversity loss , narrow the digital divide between the internet haves and have nots and step up the fight against pandemics in the face of NN hesitancy and drug resistance . “ I am angry about the NN of the NN but I am RB determined to engage and provide solutions and deliver , ” WWF director general Marco Lambertini VBD AFP . “ There needs to be healthy balance between these CD sentiments . ”

text: Mainstream Scientist Exposes the Dangerous Reality of Chemtrails and Geoengineering Over the past few NNS , the issue of geoengineering has been popularized . Mainstream NN , academia , and NN almost unanimously support the idea of geoengineering as a perceived solution to NN NN while suppressing the NN that it has actually been in use for some NN without our consent . On the other hand , there is a growing number of NNS who are slowly beginning to understand the reality surrounding chemtrail geoengineering , and opposition is slowly growing . In a bold move against the establishment , Kate Marvel , a mainstream scientist who specializes in “ NN NN , ” spoke out at a Ted Talk against the onset of NN engineering with chemtrails , RB VBN as Solar Radiation Management or “ SRM . ” Firstly , computer theorist and founding partner of tech NN Applied Invention , Danny Hillis , came on stage and proposed a number of geoengineering concepts which MD theoretically , “ turn down the NN of the NN . ” These included sending giant parasols into NN , putting fizzy NN into the ocean , and sending chalk into the atmosphere at a rate of CD teragrams per NN to reflect sunlight and in NN slow the effects of NN NN . Now enters Kate Marvel with the opening line , “ Danny , you seem so nice , and I hope we can be friends , and you terrify me . ” Marvel RB noted that atmospheric spraying MD not do anything to effect other JJ problems such as ocean acidification . GeoEngineering refers to technologies which are VBN with the intention of interfering with the NN ’s atmosphere in order to alter NNS and NN . Most of these technologies are still in theoretical stages , however a growing body of NN suggests that some NN modification technologies such as aerosol spraying or “ cloud seeding ” have been in production for JJ decades . Almost no studies have been done which assess the effect that cloud seeding has on JJ safety or JJ NN , which shows that the NN has been VBG untested technologies on the population without our consent . In CD , NNP Director John O. Brennan spoke at a Council on Foreign Relations conference about the benefits of geoengineering . However , any mention of potential negative impacts as a result of cloud seeding was conveniently left out . Although we are all hearing from establishment figures IN Brennan that NN engineering is a JJ technology which we all have the option to accept or decline before it is implemented , that is simply not the NN . NN VBG as far back as the early 1920 ’s shows a push to develop the technology needed to VB the NN and has been implemented in some form since at least the 1970’s . This NN has been uncovered in various forms , CD of those being patents which range from April 27th of 1920 to NNP of 2003 showing interest in the development of various forms of NN modification technologies . text: In resorts and national parks , Dominica lives up to its Nature Island title . It ’s hard to find litter of any kind . But venture into the island ’s cities , drive along its roads , or peek inside a drainage ditch , and plastic trash is everywhere . Less visible trash MD make Dominica look cleaner , and a pristine Caribbean island is a place where tourists VBP to visit and spend NN . “ It MD be very simplistic to VB this is just about building back , ” VBZ Bardouille . “ I VBP there ’s a serious underestimation of the amount of trauma and post - traumatic stress , and the impact it had on the fabric of our society . We have to now look at the JJ strength of our nation , ” she VBZ . In 2018 , Dominica passed the NNP Resilience Act , which fully came into effect on the JJ day of 2019 , and in a budget address delivered last July the prime minister highlighted how far the country had come . It ’s Easter weekend in Scott ’s Head , and the sky is free of clouds . The ocean laps the shore with meditative regularity ; the wind barely moves . I saw starvation , NNS grasping , fighting for food and for NN . There are still NNS without roofs as we speak . ” This is where citizens and NN sometimes clash . Rebuilding is expensive , and reconstructing a home or a business that can VB a Category 5 hurricane is RB costlier . text: Why CD writer VBZ NN is IN NN NN on steroids • Reid R. Frazier is an NN reporter for The Allegheny Front , a Pittsburgh - VBN JJ NN outlet covering the environment in Pennsylvania . His work has aired on NPR and Marketplace . If you ’ve been following NN NN , the NN NN will feel oddly familiar these days . NNS , including the U.S. , have implemented radical policies that MD have been unthinkable a few weeks ago to slow the spread of the NN . Is this what it will take to solve the NN NN ? On the latest episode of our NNP on NNP podcast , CD NN reporter and writer VBZ the NN NN ca n’t be separated from the coming NN NN . Last NN Emily Atkin launched the HEATED newsletter which , in her words , is for NNS who are pissed off about NN NN . Atkin has now turned Heated into a podcast series about the intersection of NN NN and NN . It ’s running on the podcast feed for Drilled ( another NN - related podcast you should be listening to ) . She spoke with CD of the NNP on NNP podcast host , The Allegheny Front ’s Reid Frazier . Reid Frazier : Tell me about the podcast series and why you decided to do it . Emily Atkin : I was sitting here watching this JJ NN take over society , politics and our lives . And I was confused about how I should be approaching it as a NN journalist . I knew there were clear parallels : It ’s a problem that threatens millions of lives across the NN . NNS are telling us to act very rapidly and quickly , and yet we ’re not doing that . I wanted to talk to RB smart NNS about that . I figured I might as well record [ those conversations ] and make it available for other NNS to listen to so that we MD all figure it out together . NN is obviously hugely JJ in that it is much faster and the impacts to JJ NN are much more urgent . I VBP we ’re all VBG to VB NNS close to us either financially affected or affected in their NN . This is touching every aspect of our lives very obviously RB now , whereas NN NN is touching every aspect of our NN RB now , too , but it ’s a little less obvious day - to - day . The other thing is that with NN , we do n’t have as JJ of an industry whose whole livelihood depends on the NN keeping VBG . The pharmaceutical industry will be fine NN or not . The fossil fuel industry will not be fine if we solve NN NN because there will be no fossil fuel industry . But the JJ similarities here are that NN NN is a problem that wo n’t be solved unless we take RB radical NN very quickly on a JJ scale . It ca n’t be done without the biggest nations on NNP . It ’s a problem where millions of lives are threatened ; not only lives , but society in general . It ’s a problem where we have to listen to NNS . There are no compromises VBN on biology or physics . NN dioxide warms the atmosphere . If we VBP the atmosphere to stop NN , we VBP to reduce the amount of NN dioxide . Just the same , NN is a NN that attacks ourselves and that ’s why we VBP to stay away from each other . It ’s basic NN and physics . There are RB some JJ similarities : a reluctance to admit to the scale of the problem as we VBP it . I VBP we saw that with NN , where we all knew it was happening , but we were RP , ‘ but it ’s not VBG to affect me and I do n’t RB have to do anything . ’ NN is basically just NN NN sped up CD times over . It ’s IN NN NN on steroids . RF : As you mentioned , there ’s this resistance to listening to what the NNS are telling us . With NN NN , you can basically VB away with that for NNS . That is that the terrible thing about NN NN – the ramifications of our actions ( or inaction wo n’t be felt until the next generation . But , with NN , it ’s UH three weeks . But there ’s some part of your brain that you MD compartmentalize and VB that it was n’t NN NN . It ’s not IN NN where if they die from NN , they die from NN . The fossil fuel industry is trying to take advantage of the NN and make sure they can survive when this is done . These are all things that we VBP to keep in NN as we ’re self - isolating and trying to deal with this NN . It ’s not that we ’ve replaced CD NN for the other , it ’s that now we have CD to deal with . RF : There ’s been an effort from JJ groups and some in the Democratic Party to infuse any recovery package with green policies , almost VB to kickstart a Green NNP Deal . What have you made of the debate about whether any recovery package should incentivize decarbonization or ramp up renewables ? EA : It does n’t seem unrelated to me . If society were gonna VB where we wanted it to VB anyway , which is where we do n’t die from four degrees Celsius of NN , we VBP a mass investment in green jobs . That ’s not just renewable NN jobs , that ’s things IN planting mangrove trees and restoring ecosystems . text: Seems that beauty product ads are becoming important mediums to push NN NN / illuminati symbolism . The short NN advertisement for Rihanna ’s perfume Reb’l Fleur is crammed with NN NN triggers and monarch programming symbolism . Rihanna is RB shown lying inside a flower , representing purity and innocence . She is then walks towards a mirror reflecting herself dressed in black – representing her “ bad side ” and her alter persona . While she is VBG through the “ looking glass ” ( reference to Alice in Wonderland ) , we VBP written “ Bad Feels so Good ” . In NN NN , slaves are encouraged to embrace their bad side ( their alter persona ) as it is the only NN to be relieved from their trauma / torture . So , yes , it feels bad to be good . Once through the looking glass , Rihanna is shown walking through a maze surrounded by fractured mirrors . Labyrinths and fractured mirrors are NN NN triggers representing the internal NN of NN NN victims : JJ reality , illusion and confusion . Only the handler , represented by the men in black , hold the key to their psyche . Rihanna ’s handlers are literally in her head , watching her VBG through the maze . They then take a hold of her . Rihanna blinded by her three handlers The scene becomes oddly sexual as Rihanna holds the phallic - shaped perfume bottle while she is blinded by her handlers . text: Anthropogenic NN NN is already a reality in Africa , as it is elsewhere in the NN . According to the Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP , Africa is among the most vulnerable continents to NN NN . [ 1] [ 2 ] The vulnerability of Africa to NN NN is driven by a range of factors that includes weak adaptive capacity , high dependence on ecosystem goods for livelihoods , and less developed agricultural production systems . [ 3 ] The risks of NN NN on agricultural production , food security , NN resources and ecosystem services will likely have increasingly severe consequences on lives and sustainable development prospects in Africa . [ 4 ] Managing this NN requires integration of mitigation and NN strategies in the management of ecosystem goods and services , and the agriculture production systems in Africa . [ 5 ] Over the coming decades , NN from NN NN is expected across almost all the NN 's NN , and JJ mean rainfall will increase . [ 6 ] Regional effects on rainfall in the tropics are expected to be much more spatially variable and the sign of NN at any CD location is often less certain , although NNS are expected . Consistent with this , observed NN NNS have generally increased over Africa since the late 19th century to the early 21st century by about 1 °C , but locally as much as 3 °C for minimum NN in the Sahel at the end of the dry season . [ 7 ] Observed precipitation trends indicate spatial and temporal discrepancies as expected . [ 8 ] [ 2 ] The observed NNS in NN and precipitation vary regionally . [ 9 ] [ 8 ] In terms of NN efforts , regional - level actors are making some progress . This includes the development and adoption of several regional NN NN NN strategies [ CD ] e.g. SADC Policy Paper NNP NNP , [ 11 ] and the NN strategy for the NN sector . [ 12 ] In addition , there has been other efforts to enhance NN NN NN , such as the tripatite Programme on NN NN NN and Mitigation in Eastern and Southern Africa ( COMESA-EAC-SADC ) . [ 13 ] As a supranational organisation of 55 member NNS , the African Union has put forward 47 goals and corresponding actions in a 2014 draft report [ 14 ] to combat and mitigate NN NN on the continent . The Secretary General of the NNP Nations has RB declared a NN for close cooperation with the African Union in order to tackle NN NN , in accordance with the UN 's sustainable development goals . NN NN will increasingly impact Africa due to JJ factors . These impacts are already being felt and will increase in magnitude if NN is not taken to reduce JJ NN NNS . The impacts include higher NNS , drought , changing rainfall patterns and increased NN variability . These conditions have a bearing on NN production and consumption . The recent drought in JJ African NNS , which has been linked to NN NN , adversely affected both NN security and JJ growth across the continent . Agriculture is inherently sensitive to NN conditions and is CD of the most vulnerable sectors to the risks and impacts of JJ NN NN . [ 17 ] Agriculture in most African NNS is mainly JJ - scale and rain - fed , making it particularly vulnerable to NN variability and NN . Observed and projected disruptions in precipitation patterns due to NN NN are likely to shorten growing seasons and affect crop yield in JJ parts of Africa . Furthermore , the agriculture sector in Africa is dominated by smallholder farmers with limited access to technology and the resources to adapt . [ 18 ] NN variability and NN have been and continue to be , the principal source of fluctuations in JJ food production in NNS of the developing NN where production is highly rain - dependent . [ CD ] The agriculture sector is sensitive to NN variability , [ 20 ] especially the inter-annual variability of precipitation , NN patterns , and extreme NN events ( droughts and floods ) . These climatic events are predicted to increase in the future and are expected to have significant consequences to the agriculture sector . [ 21 ] This MD have a negative influence on food prices , food security , and land - use decisions . [ 22 ] Yields from rainfed agriculture in some African NNS MD be reduced by up to 50 % by 2020 . [ 21 ] In order to prevent the future destructive impact of NN variability on food production , it is crucial to adjust or suggest possible policies to cope with increased NN variability . African NNS VBP to build a national legal framework to manage food resources in accordance with the anticipated NN variability . However , before devising a policy to cope with the impacts of NN variability , especially to the agriculture sector , it is critical to have a clear understanding of how NN variability affects JJ food crops . In the NN 2020 , sever invasion of Locusts harmed the agriculture in eastern Africa . The invasion is at least partly due to NN NN - the warmer NN and heavier rainfall caused an abnormal increase in the number of locusts [ 23 ] NN quality and availability have deteriorated in most areas of Africa particularly due to NN NN . Previous research and NN projections provide enough NN that NN resources are vulnerable and have the possibility of being strongly impacted by NN NN with vast ramifications on JJ societies . [ 24 ] The IPCC predicts millions of NNS in Africa will persistently face increased NN stress due to NN variability and NN ( IPCC 2013 ) . NNS in precipitation patterns directly affect NN runoff and NN availability . [ 25 ] Any NNS to the hydrological cycle MD have significant effects on river basins of Africa . To improve understanding of past and future NNS in NN availability due to NN NN , the IPCC ( IPCC 2013 ) recommends VBG the dynamic downscaling technique . The IPCC 2013 proposed VBG the coordinated regional downscaling experiment ( CORDEX ) regional NN models which runs at a maximum of 50 km resolutions , the resolution VBN depends upon the size of the watershed and area coverage by the meteorological records . However , before VBG the NN simulations from the dynamic downscaling , it is appropriate to evaluate their performance at JJ spatial scales since their performance differs from CD location to another and from CD RCM to another . African NNS have the least efficient JJ NN systems in the NN . [ 26 ] Infectious NN burdens such as malaria , schistosomiasis , dengue fever , meningitis , which are sensitive to NN impacts , are highest in the sub-Saharan African region . For instance , over 90 percent of annual JJ malaria NNS are in Africa . [ 26 ] NNS in NN will affect the spread of infectious agents as well as alter NNS ’s disposition to these infections . With increasing population and corresponding NN demand , NN security must be addressed because NN is crucial for sustainable development . NN NN has affected NN sectors in Africa as JJ NNS depend on hydropower generation . Decreasing rainfall levels and droughts have resulted in lower NN levels in dams with adverse impacts on hydropower generation . This has resulted in low electrical NN production , high cost of electricity and NN outages or load - shedding in some African NNS that depend on hydroelectric NN generation . Disruptions in hydropower generation have negatively affected various sectors in NNS such as Ghana , Uganda , Kenya , Tanzania . Central Africa , for the most part , is landlocked and is geographically threatened by NN NN . Due to its high NN variability and rainfed agriculture , Central Africa is expected to experience longer and more frequent heatwaves as well as an increase in wet extremes . [ 27 ] The JJ mean NN in this region is to increase by 1.5 °C to 2 °C . [ 28 ] Angola - " The objective of the National NNP Programs of NNP are to identify and communicate the urgent and immediate needs of the country regarding NN NN NN , to increase Angola ‘s resilience to NN variabilities and to NN NN to ensure achievement of Poverty reduction programs , sustainable development objectives and the Millennium Development Goals pursued by the NNP . " [ 29 ] The NN dioxide - absorbing capacity of forests in the Congo Basin have decreased . This decrease has occurred due to increasing heat and drought causing decreased tree growth . This suggests that RB unlogged forests are being affected by NN NN . A Nature NN indicates that by 2030 , the African jungle will absorb 14 percent less NN dioxide than it did from IN 2005 - 2010 , and will absorb none at all by 2035 . [ 30 ] Situated almost entirely in the tropics , rainfall in Eastern Africa is dominated by the seasonal migration of the tropical - rain band . [ 31 ] Eastern Africa is characterized by high spatio - temporal rainfall variability as it spans over 30 degrees of latitude ( across the equator ) . It has influences from both the Indian and Atlantic Oceans , and has major orographic features ( highlands ) as well as inland NN bodies such as Lake Victoria . Therefore the rainfall seasonality varies from a single wet season per NN in July –August in parts of the northwest ( including Ethiopia and South Sudan , which are meteorologically more connected to West Africa , with the West African monsoon bringing the rains ) to a single wet season per NN in December - February in the south ( over Tanzania ) , with JJ areas close to the equator having CD rainy seasons per NN , [ 32 ] approximately in March–May ( the “ NNP Rains ” ) and October to December ( the “ Short Rains ” ) . Fine - scale variability in rainfall seasonality is often linked to orography and lakes . Inter - annual variability can be JJ and VBN controls include variations in NN NN NNS ( SSTs ) of JJ ocean basins , JJ - scale atmospheric modes of variability such as the Madden - Julian Osciliation ( MJO ) [ 33 ] [ 34 ] and tropical cyclones . [ 34 ] [ 35 ] Eastern Africa has witnessed frequent and severe droughts in recent decades , as well as devastating floods . Trends in rainfall since the 1980s show a general decrease in March - NNP ( MAM ) seasonal rains with a slight increase during June - September ( JJAS ) and October - December ( OND ) rains , [ 36 ] although there appears to have been a recent recovery in the MAM rains . [ 37 ] In the future , both rainfall and NN are projected to VB over Eastern Africa . [ 38 ] [ 39 ] [ 40 ] Recent studies on NN projections suggest that average NN might increase by about 2 - 3 °C by the middle of the century and 2 - 5 °C at the end of the century . [ 41 ] This will depend on emission scenarios as well as on how the real NN responds compared with the range of possible outcomes shown by models . NN model projections tend to show an increase in rainfall , particularly during OND season , which is RB projected to occur later . This delay in the short rain season , has been linked to the deepening of the Saharan Heat Low under NN NN . [ 42 ] It should be noted , however that some models predict decreasing rainfall , [ 40 ] [ 41 ] and for some regions and seasons the very largest rainfall increases predicted have been shown to involve implausible mechanisms due to systematic model errors . [ 43 ] In addition , NNS of aerosols provide a forcing of rainfall NN that is not captured in JJ assessments of NN projections . [ 44 ] [ 45 ] The contrast of the drying trend of MAM ( JJ rains ) rainfall in equatorial Eastern Africa , with most models predicting a wetting in the future has been labelled the “ East African NN NN paradox , " [ 45 ] although there has been some recent recovery in the rainfall . [ 37 ] Studies have shown that the drying trend is unlikely to be purely natural , but MD be driven by factors such as aerosols rather than NN gases , [ 45 ] further research is needed . The drying has been shown to be have been caused by a shorter rainy season , and linked to deepening of the Arabian Heat Low . [ 37 ] Consistent with the uncertainty in rainfall projections , NNS in rainy seasons onset are uncertain in equatorial Eastern Africa , although JJ models predict a later and wetter short rains . [ 42 ] The Indian Ocean Dipole ( IOD ) is VBN to provide a strong NN on inter-annual variability in the short rains , [ 46 ] and studies show that extreme IODs MD increase under NN NN . [ 47 ] Globally , NN NN is expected to lead to intensification of rainfall , as extreme rainfall increases at a faster rate with NN than total rainfall does . [ 6 ] Recent work shows that across Africa JJ models are expected to under -estimate the rate of NN of this rainfall intensification , [ 48 ] and NNS in rainfall extremes MD be much more widespread than those predicted by JJ models . [ 49 ] Southern parts of Eastern Africa receive most of their rainfall in a single rainy season during the southern hemisphere ’s winter : over Tanzania seasonal rainfall is projected to increase under future NN NN , although there is uncertainty . [ 42 ] Further south , over Mozambique , a shorter season due to a later onset is projected under future NN NN , again with some uncertainty . [ 50 ] Comoros - " NAPA is the operational extension of the Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper ( PRSP ) , as it includes among its NN priorities , agriculture , fishing , NN , housing , NN , but RB tourism , in an indirect NN , through the reconstitution of basin slopes and the fight against soils erosion , and therefore the protection of reefs by limiting the silting up by terrigenous contributions . [ 51 ] " Kenya gazetted the NNP NNP Act , CD which establishes an authority to oversee development , management , implementation and regulation of mechanisms to enhance NN NN resilience and low NN development for sustainable development , by the National and County Governments , the private sector , civil society , and other actors . Kenya has RB developed the National NNP NNP NNP Plan ( NCCAP 2018 - 2022 ) which aims to further the country 's development goals by providing mechanisms and measures to achieve low NN NN - resilient development in a manner that prioritizes NN . Madagascar - the priority sectors for NN are : agriculture and livestock , forestry , JJ NN , NN resources and coastal zones . [ 52 ] Malawi - The NAPA identifies the following as high priority activities for NN : " Improving community resilience to NN NN through the development of sustainable rural livelihoods , Restoring forests in the Upper and Lower Shire Valleys catchments to reduce siltation and associated NN flow problems , Improving agricultural production under erratic rains and changing climatic conditions , Improving Malawi ’s preparedness to cope with droughts and floods , and Improving NN monitoring to enhance Malawi ’s early warning capability and decision making and sustainable utilization of Lake Malawi and lakeshore areas resources [ 53 ] " . Mauritius - NN should address the following priority areas : coastal resources , agriculture , NN resources , fisheries , NN and well - being , land use NN and forestry and biodiversity . [ 54 ] Mozambique - " The proposed NN initiatives target various areas of JJ and JJ development , and outline projects related to the reduction of impacts to natural disasters , the creation of NN measures to NN NN , fight against soil erosion in areas of high desertification and coastal zones , reforestation and the management of NN resources . [ 55 ] " Rwanda has developed the National NNP Programme of NNP ( NAPA 2006 ) which contains NN to guide national policy - makers and planners on priority vulnerabilities and adaptations in important JJ sectors . [ 56 ] The country has RB developed sector VBN policies on NN to NN NN such as the Vision 2020 , the National NNP Policy and the Agricultural Policy among others . [ 57 ] Tanzania Tanzania has outlined priority NN measures in their NAPA , and various national sector strategies and research outputs . [ 58 ] The NAPA has been successful at encouraging NN NN mainstreaming into sector policies in Tanzania ; however , the cross-sectoral collaboration crucial to implementing NN strategies remains limited due to institutional challenges such as NN imbalances , budget constraints and an ingrained sectoral approach . [ 59 ] Most of the projects in Tanzania concern agriculture and NN resource management ( irrigation , NN saving , rainwater collection ) ; however , NN and tourism RB play an important role . [ 60 ] Zambia - " The NAPA identifies 39 urgent NN needs and CD priority areas within the sectors of agriculture and food security ( livestock , fisheries and crops ) , NN and NN , JJ NN , natural resources and wildlife [ 61 ] " Zimbabwe - " The other strategic interventions by the NAP process will be : Strengthening the role of private sector in NN planning , Enhancing of the capacity of NN to develop bankable projects through trainings , Improving management of background NN NN to inform NN NN planning , Crafting a proactive resource - mobilization strategy for identifying and applying for international NN finance as requests for funds are primarily reactive at present , focusing on emergency relief rather than NN NN NN reduction , preparedness and NN , Developing a coordinated monitoring and evaluation policy for programs and projects , as JJ institutions within the NN do not currently have a systematic approach to monitoring and evaluation . [ 62 ] " Lesotho - " The key objectives of the NAPA process entail : identification of communities and livelihoods most vulnerable to NN NN , generating a list of activities that MD form a core of the national NN program of NN , and to communicate the country ’s immediate and urgent needs and priorities for building capacity for NN to NN NN [ 63 ] " Namibia - the critical themes for NN are " Food security and sustainable biological resource base , Sustainable NN resources base , JJ NN and well being and Infrastructure development [ 64 ] " South Africa is in the progress of finalizing its national NN NN NN strategy . " The National NNP strategy acts as a common reference point for NN NN NN efforts in South Africa , and it provides a platform upon which national NN NN NN objectives for the country can be articulated so as to provide overarching guidance to all sectors of the economy [ 65 ] " The West African region can be divided into four climatic sub-regions namely the Guinea Coast , Soudano - Sahel , Sahel ( extending eastward to the Ethiopian border ) and the Sahara , [ 66 ] each with JJ climatic conditions . The seasonal cycle of rainfall is mainly driven by the south - north movement of the Inter - Tropical Convergence Zone ( ITCZ ) which is characterised by the confluence between moist southwesterly monsoon winds and the dry northeasterly Harmattan . [ 67 ] VBN on the inter -annual rainfall variability , three main climatic periods have been observed over the Sahel : the wet period from 1950 to the early 1960s followed by a dry period from 1972 to 1990 and then the period from 1991 onwards which has seen a partial rainfall recovery . [ 68 ] [ 69 ] [ 70 ] During the dry period , the Sahel experienced a number of particularly severe drought events , with devastating effects . [ 71 ] [ 72 ] The recent decades , have RB witnessed a moderate increment in annual rainfall since the beginning of 1990s . However , total annual rainfall remains significantly below that observed during the 1950s . [ 73 ] [ 71 ] Some have identified the recent 2 decades as a recovery period . [ 74 ] Others refer to this as a period of ‘ hydrological intensification ’ with much of the annual rainfall increase coming from more severe rain events and sometimes flooding rather than more frequent rainfall , or similarly other works [ 75 ] [ 76 ] underline the continuity of the drought RB though the rainfall has increased . Since 1985 , 54 percent of the population has been affected by five or more floods in the 17 Sahel region NNS . [ 77 ] In 2012 , severe drought conditions in the Sahel were reported . Governments in the region responded quickly , launching strategies to address the issue . [ 78 ] The region is projected to experience NNS in rainfall regime , with NN models suggesting that decreases in wet season rainfall are more likely in the western Sahel , and increases more likely in the central to east Sahel , although opposite trends can not yet be ruled out . [ 79 ] [ 80 ] [ 81 ] These trends will affect the frequency and severity of floods , droughts , desertification , sand and dust storms , desert locust plagues and NN shortages . [ 82 ] [ 83 ] However , irrespective of the NNS in seasonal mean rain , the most intense storms are expected to become more intense , amplifying flood frequency . [ 84 ] [ 85 ] Enhanced NN NNS and JJ NN MD RB lead to an increase in dry spells especially across the Guinea Coast associated with a reduction of the wet spells under both 1.5 ℃ and 2 ℃ JJ NN level . [ 86 ] Fifteen percent of Sahel region population has RB experienced a NN increase of more than 1 °C from 1970 to 2010 . The Sahel region , in particular , will experience higher average NNS over the course of the 21st century and NNS in rainfall patterns , according to the Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP ( IPCC ) . NN NN , and resulting in increased NNS , storms , droughts , and rising NN levels , will affect the incidence and distribution of infectious NN across the globe . [ 87 ] This is JJ in Africa , where malaria continues to have dramatic effects on the population . As NN NN continues , the specific areas likely to experience the NN - round , high - NN transmission of malaria will shift from coastal West Africa to an area between the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Uganda , VBN as the African Highlands . [ 88 ] To understand the exposures that affect shifting malaria transmission rates we can look to The Epidemiologic Triad , a model that explains the relationship between exposure , transmission , and causation of infectious diseases . [ 89 ] With regards to malaria transmission rates in the African Highlands , factors and exposures resulting from drastic JJ NNS IN warmer climates , shifts in NN patterns , and increases in JJ impact such as deforestation , provide appropriate conditions for malaria transmission between carrier and host . [ 90 ] Because of this , vectors will adapt , thrive , and multiply at a fast pace . An increase in the number of vectors that carry parasites , microbes , and pathogens that VBP NN will become a NN hazard for the JJ population . [ 87 ] Specifically , malaria is caused by the Plasmodium falciparum and Plasmodium vivax parasites which are carried by the vector Anopheles mosquito . RB though the Plasmodium vivax parasite can survive in lower NNS , the Plasmodium falciparum parasite will only survive and replicate in the mosquito when NN NNS are above 20 ℃ . [ 91 ] Increases in humidity and rain RB contribute to the replication and survival of this infectious agent . , [ 92 ] Increasing JJ NNS combined with NNS in land cover as a result of extreme deforestation will create ideal habitats for mosquitoes to survive in the African Highlands . If deforestation continues at its current rate , more land will be available for mosquito breeding grounds , and the population of mosquitos will rapidly increase . The increase in mosquitoes will thus increase the opportunity for both Plasmodium falciparum and Plasmodium vivax parasites to proliferate . Exposure to malaria will become a greater NN to NNS as the number of female Anopheles mosquitos infected with either the Plasmodium falciparum or Plasmodium vivax parasite increases . [ 92 ] The mosquito will transmit the parasite to the JJ host through a bite , resulting in infection . Then , when an uninfected mosquito bites the now infected JJ host , the parasite will be transmitted to the mosquitoes which will then become an exposure to other uninfected JJ hosts . Individuals who are constantly exposed to the Malaria parasite due to multiple bites by mosquitoes that carry the parasite are at greater NN of dying . [ 91 ] Infected NNS can RB transmit the NN to uninfected or healthy NNS via contaminated NN . [ 91 ] The NN effects caused by shifts in malaria transmission rates in the African Highlands have the potential to be severe . Research has shown that the effects of NN NN on NN will impact most populations over the next few decades . [ 93 ] However , Africa , and specifically the African Highlands , are susceptible to being particularly negatively affected . In 2010 , 91 % of the JJ burden due to malaria deaths occurred in Africa . Several spatiotemporal models have been studied to assess the potential effect of projected NN scenarios on malaria transmission in Africa . A NN conducted by Caminade FW FW . [ 94 ] concluded that the most significant NN NN effects are confined to specific regions , including the African Highlands . These results are consistent with previous studies . Ultimately , studies show an overall increase in NN suitability for malaria transmission resulting in an increase in the population at NN of contracting the NN . [ 94 ] Of significant importance is the increase of epidemic potential at higher altitudes ( IN the African Highlands ) . Rising NNS in these areas have the potential to VB normally non-malarial areas to areas with seasonal epidemics . [ 95 ] Consequently , JJ populations will be exposed to the NN resulting in healthy NNS lost . In addition , the NN burden MD be more detrimental to areas that lack the ability and resources to effectively respond to such challenges and stresses . [ 96 ] Scientific limitations when examining shifting malaria transmission rates in the African Highlands are similar to those related to broader understandings of NN NN and malaria . While modeling with NN NNS shows that there is a relationship between an increase in NN and an increase in malaria transmission , limitations still exist . Future population shifts that affect population density , as well as NNS in the behavior of mosquitos , can affect transmission rates and are limiting factors in determining the future NN of malaria outbreaks , which RB affect planning for correct outbreak response preparation . [ 88 ] The challenges of controlling and possibly eradicating malaria in the African Highlands are JJ and varied . JJ of the strategies VBN to VB malaria have not changed , are few in number and have rarely been added to in the last 20 NNS . The most common forms of NN are educating the NN and vector NN . The huge geographic area of the vectors Anopheles is possibly the largest challenge faced in the NN of malaria . With such a JJ area to cover it is hard to use insecticides at a continuous and effective level . [ 97 ] This form of NN is expensive , and the areas affected are not able to sustain NN . Without sustained NN , a rapid resurgence in parasite transmission is seen . Another challenge with insecticides is that the vector is now becoming insecticide - resistant . Due to the fact that mosquitoes have several generations per NN , resistance is seen very quickly . [ 97 ] Education has its limitations as well , as the population most affected by malaria are NNS , and the educational message is to stay inside during peak mosquito activity . The low socioeconomic status of the NNS who inhabit the African Highlands is RB a challenge . Local NN facilities have limited resources , and poor living conditions and malnourishment exacerbate malaria NNS and increase the likelihood of death due to malaria . [ 97 ] As NN NN shifts geographic areas of transmission to the African Highlands , the challenge will be to find and VB the vector in areas that have not seen it before , and to not waste resources on areas where the NN is no longer conducive to parasite growth . [ 98 ] The solutions that can VB malaria VB and possibly lead to eradication are far fewer in number than the challenges , but if they are effective they can truly VB the areas currently affected . There are number of groups working on a NN , some are looking to VB the transmission of the parasite to the host , or VB transmission from JJ back to the vector . [ 99 ] These NNS are not very effective currently , and lose their effectiveness over NN , so are not ideal . But , the development is still progressing in the hopes of finding a better , more effective JJ - lasting NN . [ 99 ] An alternative to NNS is vectored immunoprophylaxis ( VIP ) that is a form a gene therapy . This therapy will VB cells in the host that will secrete antigens from various stages of the parasite in the hopes of triggering an anamnestic JJ response in the recipient and prevent NN and parasite transmission . [ 100 ] The policy implications of NN NN and malaria rates in the African Highlands are RB vast , and ultimately fall into CD categories : • Enacting policy that will reduce NN gas NNS , thus slowing down NN NN , and • Mitigating problems that have already arisen , and will inevitably continue to develop , due to NN NN . [ 101 ] Addressing both of these areas is of great importance , as those in the poorest NNS , including NNS that make up the African Highlands , face the greatest burden . Additionally , when NNS are forced to contend with a NN IN malaria , their prospects for JJ growth are slowed . This contributes to continued and worsening JJ inequality . [ 102 ] When addressing policy that will reduce NN gas NNS , it is necessary to act on a JJ scale , RB when related effects are narrowed to a smaller area . The 2015 Lancet Commission on NNP and NNP NNP made nine recommendations for governments to address . These include : • Support cities that encourage healthy activities for individuals and the NN . • Increase access to renewable NN in low to middle - income NNS . • Quantify avoided burdens when these measures are taken . • Create an agreement that will VB counties making NNS to become low - NN economies . [ 101 ] When PRP focuses on mitigation , specifically as it relates to malaria in the African Highlands , research is still an important component . This research needs to take JJ forms , including attribution studies , to VB clarify the degree to which malaria rates are attributed to NN NN ; scenario modeling , which can VB further our understanding of future NN NN consequences on malaria rates ; and examinations of intervention programs and techniques , to VB our understanding of what appropriate responses are . [ 102 ] Surveillance and monitoring of malaria in populations in the African Highlands will RB be important , to better understand NN . [ 101 ] Beyond these research priorities , it is RB important that we enact policies that will significantly increase investments in JJ NN in the African Highlands . This achieves CD goals , the JJ being better outcomes related to malaria in the affected area , and the second being an overall better NN environment for populations . [ 101 ] It is RB important to focus on “ CD - NN approaches . " [ 101 ] This means collaborating on an interdisciplinary level , across various geographic areas , to come up with workable solutions . These policies can be seen in NN in the NNP NNP Organization 's “ NNP to NNP NNP in Africa Plan of NNP for the NNP Sector 2012 - CD . " [ 103 ] This report “ is intended to provide a comprehensive and NN - VBN coordinated response of the NN sector to NN NN NN needs of African NNS in order to support the commitments and priorities of African governments . " [ 103 ] The NN plan includes goals IN scaling up JJ NN activities , coordinating efforts on an international scale , strengthening partnerships and collaborative efforts , and promoting research on both the effects of NN NN as well as effective measures taken in local communities to mitigate NN NN consequences . [ 103 ] • Scientific Understanding of East African NN NN from the HyCRISTAL project

text: Foals have shared a JJ animated NN for ‘ IN Lightning ’ – watch it below . In the clip , the band rally against NN NN and paint a picture of a dystopian future . • Read more : Savages ’ drummer and Music Declares Emergency co-founder Fay Milton on NN NN : “ Music needs to VB real ” The NN for ‘ NNP Lightning ’ has premiered on the website for Music Declares Emergency , the organisation set up by members of the music NN to tackle NN NN within the industry . Watch the JJ NN below . Foals have been very open about their passion for campaigning against NN NN . At the Mercury Prize ceremony in September , they held up the Music Declares Emergency banner , which reads : “ No music on a dead NN . ” Talking to NME about the gesture in a recent NNP Read interview , singer Yannis Philippakis VBD : “ Fay Milton ( of Savages ) is an old friend and great drummer . I was talking to her about Extinction Rebellion then we signed up to Music Declares Emergency . “ We ’d been NN offsetting before that and we ’d been aware of JJ problems . It ’s definitely disturbed me for a while , that ’s why a lot of the lyrics on these CD records pertain to that . ” He continued : “ On the day of the Mercury Prize , we thought it MD be good to bring exposure to Music Declares and just to VB that sentiment across . It ’s easy to VB , ‘ Oh , everyone knows what ’s VBG on with the environment and everyone ’s making NNS ’ , but it ’s CD of those echo chamber things where you forget that actually lots of NNS either do n’t care , do n’t VB it or do n’t act upon it . ” NME recently spoke to Fay Milton about the organisation and what the music industry can do to combat NN NN . “ There ’s such a short period of NN to make the NNS we VBP to make , and to make NNS wake up and realise that there is n’t NN for everyone to VB everything they do , ” she VBD . “ To use Greta Thunberg ’s analogy , the NN is on fire , and there is n’t NN for whoever started the fire with their cigarette to quit smoking before saying the NN is on fire – it ’s on fire now , and we VBP to fix this . Let ’s VB our lifestyles , let ’s fly less , let ’s use less plastic – but ultimately what ’s needed is a governmental response . ” Foals RB released a JJ live film called Rip Up The Road . In an NME review of the film , James McMahon VBD : “ Rip Up The Road is a film where we VBP the opportunity to understand Foals in a NN we ’ve never done before . “ Simultaneously it gives the band a canvas to do the same about themselves . It is a film that asks why we love music and why music is made and shows us the men behind the melodies . ”

text: The 2013 EU strategy on NN to NN NN aims at contributing to a more NN - resilient Europe . However , there are still JJ gaps in understanding and characterising NN impacts in Europe and how impacts in the rest of the NN MD affect Europe . This report provides quantitative modelling - VBN results from biophysical and agro-economic models as part of the PESETA - IV ( Projection of JJ impacts of NN NN in Sectors of the European Union VBN on bottom - up Analysis ) project . We analyse NN NN projections for 2050 considering the Representative Concentration Pathway ( RCP ) of 8.5 W/m2 ( with corresponding JJ NN levels ranging between 1.6 oC and 2.7 oC compared to pre-industrial levels ) , as well as for 1.5 °C and 2 °C NN conditions . Results show that NN NN will pose a threat to JJ food production in the medium to JJ term , and that Europe will RB be affected . Forced by the projected NNS in daily NN , precipitation , wind , relative humidity , and JJ radiation , grain maize yields in the EU will decline between 1 % and 22 % . In addition , wheat yields in Southern Europe are expected to decrease by up to 49 % . However , in Northern Europe some of the negative productivity effects caused by NN NN MD be partially offset by higher levels of atmospheric CO2 concentrations and changing precipitation regimes . Losses , especially in Southern Europe MD be reduced by tailored NN strategies ; e.g. changing varieties and crop types , increasing and improving irrigation practices for certain crops and when economically feasible . However , limitations on sustainable NN abstraction levels MD become a barrier to increase irrigation levels , specifically in the Mediterranean NNS ( particularly Spain , Portugal , Greece , Cyprus , Malta , Italy and Turkey ) where duration of NN scarcity under JJ NN are projected to intensify . As JJ negative NN NN impacts on productivity outside of the EU are estimated , JJ NN spill - over effects will push up production in both Northern and Southern Europe through higher demand for some agricultural commodities outside of EU , resulting in higher producer prices . This , in turn , MD benefit farmers ' income and have positive effects on the EU ’s agricultural commodity exports . However , other limiting factors ( not all fully integrated into the VBN modelling NN yet ) , such as increasing NN shortage in Southern Europe ( Task CD ) and constraints on the expansion of irrigation , increasing impacts of heatwaves and droughts , consequences of reduction of nutrient use due to JJ and NN mitigation constraints , VBP to be further evaluated .

text: A highly qualified and experienced NN modeler with impeccable credentials has rejected the unscientific bases of the doom - mongering over a purported NN NN . His work has not yet been picked up in this country , but that is about to VB . Writing at the Australian site Quadrant , Tony Thomas introduces the English - speaking NN to the truth - telling of Dr. Mototaka Nakamura ( hat tip : Andrew Bolt , John McMahon ) . There ’s a top - level oceanographer and meteorologist who is prepared to cry “ Nonsense ! ” on the “ JJ NN NN ” evident to NN modellers but not in the real NN . He ’s as well or better qualified than the modellers he criticises — the ones whose NN 2100 forebodings of 4degC NN have set the NN to spending $ US1.5 trillion a NN to combat CO2 NNS . The iconoclast is Dr. Mototaka Nakamura . In June he put out a JJ book in Japanese on “ the sorry NN of NN NN ” . It ’s titled Confessions of a NN scientist : the JJ NN hypothesis is an unproven hypothesis , and he is very much qualified to take a stand . From 1990 to 2014 he worked on cloud dynamics and forces mixing atmospheric and ocean flows on medium to planetary scales . His bases were MIT ( for a NNP of NNP in meteorology ) , Georgia Institute of Technology , Goddard NNP Flight Centre , Jet Propulsion Laboratory , Duke and Hawaii Universities and the Japan Agency for Marine - NNP NNP and Technology . He ’s published about 20 NN papers on fluid dynamics . [ i ] Today ’s vast panoply of “ JJ NN NN ” is IN an upside down pyramid built on the work of a few score of serious NN modellers . They claim to have demonstrated JJ - derived CO2 NNS as the NN of recent JJ NN and project that NN forward . Every orthodox NN researcher takes such output from the modellers ’ black boxes as a given . Dr. Nakamura has just made his work available to the English - speaking NN : And the critique he offers is comprehensive . Now Nakamura has VBN it again , further accusing the orthodox NNS of “ NN falsification ” by adjusting previous NN NNS to increase apparent NN “ The JJ NN mean NN - NN NNS no longer have any scientific value and are nothing except a propaganda tool to the NN , ” he writes . The NN models are useful tools for academic studies , he VBZ . However , “ the models just become useless pieces of junk or worse ( worse in a sense that they can produce gravely misleading output ) when they are VBN for NN forecasting . ” The reason : These models completely lack some critically important NN processes and feedbacks , and represent some other critically important NN processes and feedbacks in grossly distorted manners to the extent that makes these models totally useless for any meaningful NN prediction . I myself VBD to use NN simulation models for scientific studies , not for predictions , and learned about their problems and limitations in the process . NN forecasting is simply impossible , if only because future NNS in solar NN output are unknowable . As to the impacts of JJ - caused CO2 , they ca n’t be judged “ with the NN and technology we currently possess . ” # A complete lack of meaningful representations of aerosol NNS that generate clouds . # Lack of understanding of drivers of NN - albedo ( reflectivity ) feedbacks : “ Without a reasonably accurate representation , it is impossible to make any meaningful predictions of NN variations and NNS in the middle and high latitudes and thus the entire NN . ” # Arbitrary “ tunings ” ( fudges ) of key parameters that are not understood Concerning CO2 NNS he VBZ , I VBP to point out a simple fact that it is impossible to correctly predict RB the sense or direction of a NN of a NN when the prediction tool lacks and / or grossly distorts important non-linear processes , feedbacks in particular , that are present in the actual NN … … The real or realistically - simulated NN NN is far more complex than an absurdly simple NN simulated by the toys that have been VBN for NN predictions to date , and will be insurmountably difficult for those naïve NN researchers who have zero or very limited understanding of geophysical fluid dynamics . I understand geophysical fluid dynamics just a little , but enough to realize that the dynamics of the atmosphere and oceans are absolutely critical facets of the NN NN if PRP hopes to ever make any meaningful prediction of NN variation . Solar input , absurdly , is modelled as a “ never changing quantity ” . He VBZ , “ It has only been several decades since we acquired an ability to accurately monitor the incoming solar NN . In these several decades only , it has varied by CD to CD watts per square metre . Is it reasonable to assume that it will not vary any more than that in the next hundred NNS or longer for forecasting purposes ? I MD VB , No . ” There is much , much more . Read the whole thing . But who are you VBG to VB : a superbly qualified Japanese scientist or a Swedish teenager with mental issues ?

text: Dr. Houghton ’s other books include “ JJ NN : The Complete Briefing , ” RB published in 1994 , and “ Does NNP Play Dice ? A Look at the Story of the Universe ” ( 1988 ) . He married Margaret Broughton in 1962 ; she died in 1986 . In 1988 , he married Sheila Thompson . In addition to his granddaughter Hannah , he is survived by his wife ; CD NNS from his JJ marriage , Peter Houghton and Janet Malcolm ; a younger brother , Paul ; and six other grandchildren . An older brother , David , died in 2015 . In recent NNS Dr. Houghton had retired to the Welsh seaside and was fading into dementia , Hannah Malcolm VBD , adding : “ But the NN remained with him . A good NN . ” As a leader of the I.P.C.C. , he had the skills of a statesman , VBD Jean - Pascal van Ypersele of the Université Catholique de Louvain in Belgium . He recalled watching Dr. Houghton co-chair a meeting in 1995 in Madrid that led to a statement that the smoking gun of NN NN had been VBN : The influence of JJ activities on NN was becoming discernible in observations of the present , not just in projections of the future . “ Fossil fuel NNS and oil - dependent NNS were intensely lobbying at that I.P.C.C. meeting to try to dilute the message , ” Dr. van Ypersele VBD . But Dr. Houghton , he added , “ had a deep understanding of the NN , ” and “ he was RB a British gentleman , able to listen patiently to the views of vested interests , and manage the meeting so that NNS MD have the last word , as it should be . ” After a marathon session that was still VBG at 4 a.m. , the tough language was approved . Despite such efforts , however , effective JJ NN to blunt the effects of a NN NN has yet to happen . In a series of NNP messages about her grandfather , Ms. Malcolm VBD : “ When I was younger , my consistent memory of him was warnings over the devastation waiting us if we did n’t act on NN NN . And I remember thinking how glad I was that NNS IN him were in charge . But of course it is n’t the NNS in charge . ”

text: Maybe the NNP MD be better off if the NNS who VBP they care so much about it just stayed home and did n’t create more garbage .
