Is it because powerful proponents of JJ depopulation serve in the most powerful JJ positions in the NN ? Have n't we seen this before ? Do we RB VB to VB it again ? How these questions are answered is entirely up to you . This textbook is being VBN to teach NNS that chemical aerosols are harmless NN vapor " condensation trails " , but this is blatantly JJ . Jet engines do not produce condensation trails except under extremely rare conditions , and these will be too short and too high to be seen from the group . In fact , most NNS will never VB a JJ condensation trail in their entire lives . JJ skywatchers and airline pilots have come forward to express their disdain about the blatant disinformation being VBN to the NN regarding contrail formation . Below is an excerpt from the school textbook entitled " NNP Studies " . We have provided photos and a transcript of chapter 7 which is entitled " Clouds , Prescription , and NNP Radar " . A familiar sight in the daytime sky almost anywhere is contrails , bright white streamers of NN crystals that form in the exhaust of jet aircraft ( Figure 7.1 ) . Contrails are modifying the cloud cover along heavily traveled air corridors between major urban areas with possible implications for NN and NN . According to some studies , contrails already cover about 5 % of the sky in some portions of the eastern NNP NNPS . A contrail , short for condensation trail , develops when the hot humid air in jet engine exhaust mixes with the cold , drier air at high altitudes . Turbulence in the exhaust causes the mixing . A similar process enables us to “ VB our breath ” when we exhale on a cold winter day . For details on this process , VB this chapter ’s JJ Essay , “ Clouds by Mixing . ” Depending on atmospheric conditions , contrails MD dissipate ( sublimate ) within minutes or hours , or they MD spread laterally forming wispy cirrus clouds that persist for a day or so . Atmospheric NNS hypothesized that increased cloud cover caused by contrails MD effect the local radiation budget in CD ways : During daylight hours , contrails and their cirrus byproducts incoming solar radiation thereby cooling NNP ’s NN . At night , contrails and associated cirrus clouds absorb and emit infrared radiation welling up from below thereby enhancing the NN effect and elevating NNP ’s NN NN . Cooler days and warmer nights reduces the diurnal NN range ( DTR ) , the difference between the day ’s maximum and minimum NNS . Furthermore , contrails MD stimulate precipitation locally by supplying NN crystal nuclei for lower clouds . NNS had an opportunity to test their hypothesis regarding the impact of contrails on the radiation budget immediately after the terrorist attacks of 11 September 2001 when the Federal Aviation Administration ( FAA ) ordered a three - day shutdown of all commercial air traffic in the NNP NNPS . Almost immediately , contrails began to dissipate . David J. Travis , a NN scientist at the NNP of Wisconsin - Whitewater , and colleagues at Pennsylvania NNP NNP analyzed the effects of a contrail - free sky on NN NNS at 4,000 U.S. NN stations . They VBD that the DTR during the three - day period was about 1.1 - Celsius degree ( 2 Fahrenheit degrees ) higher than the JJ - term ( 30 - NN ) average . Furthermore , the DTR for the three - day periods preceding and following the shutdown was below the JJ - term average . These observations support the hypothesis that contrails MD contribute to NN NN by making days colder and nights warmer . With the expected future increase in JJ aircraft traffic , some NNS expect the contribution of contrails to NN NN to become more significant ; the average contrail sky coverage expected to more than double by 2050 . At this point , it is not VBN whether more contrails will have a net NN or cooling effect on JJ NN . Driving Question : How do clouds and precipitation form ! Clouds whisk across the sky in ever - changing patterns of white and gray ; fog lends an eerie silence to a dreary day . Clouds and fog are NNS of condensation or deposition of NN vapor within the atmosphere . Most clouds are the consequence of saturation brought about by uplift and expansional cooling of air . Fog is a cloud that forms near , or in contact , with NNP ’s NN ; most fogs develop when the lowest layer of air is chilled to saturation via radiational or advective cooling . Cloud formation is an essential part of the JJ NN cycle because without clouds there MD be no rain or snow . And yet most clouds — RB those associated with JJ storm systems — do not produce precipitation . The principal subjects of this chapter are the development and classification of clouds and fog , plus the formation and types of precipitation . We RB examine NN radar , a valuable tool for locating and tracking areas of precipitation and for monitoring air motion within NN systems . This chapter closes with a summary of the various direct and remote methods for measuring precipitation . NN vapor is an invisible component of air , but its condensation and deposition NNS ( NN droplets and NN crystals ) are visible . A cloud is the visible product of condensation or deposition of NN vapor within the atmosphere ; it consists of an aggregate of minute NN droplets and / or NN crystals suspended in the atmosphere . This section covers the process of cloud development . Clouds are increasingly likely to form as air nears saturation . But when NNS try to simulate this process in the laboratory VBG a clean - air chamber , a cloud does not form RB if the relative humidity is elevated well above 100 % , that is , to supersaturation values . A clean - air chamber is an enclosed container of air from which all solid and liquid particles ( aerosols ) have been filtered out . Introducing NN vapor into the chamber raises the relative humidity , but RB if the relative humidity is elevated to as high as 200 % , no cloud forms . How is that possible ? We expect that once air becomes saturated ( relative to a JJ - NN NN ) , condensation MD initially produce extremely JJ droplets and those droplets MD eventually grow into cloud droplets through additional condensation . However , droplets will not form in the JJ place unless the relative humidity rises to extraordinarily high levels of supersaturation . Tiny droplets cannot form in a cloud chamber without a supersaturated environment because of the so - called curvature effect . The curvature of a NN NN affects the ability of NN molecules to escape ( vaporize ) from the NN NN . The smaller the droplet , the greater is the concentration of surrounding NN vapor that is necessary for the droplet to grow . The curvature of the NN of a spherical NN droplet increases as the radius of the droplet decreases ; that is , the NN of a JJ droplet has a greater curvature than the NN of a JJ droplet . ( At the limit , a JJ - NN NN has no curvature . ) With increasing curvature , molecules that form the NN of a droplet have fewer neighboring molecules and are more weakly bonded . Molecules composing a JJ - NN NN have the most neighboring molecules and are most strongly bonded . Bond strength affects the flux of NN molecules from the liquid to vapor phase . For this reason , NN molecules more readily escape a NN droplet than a JJ - NN NN and NN molecules more readily escape a JJ NN droplet than a JJ NN droplet . Consequently , at the same NN , the saturation vapor pressure surrounding a JJ NN droplet is greater than that surrounding a JJ droplet . Values of saturation vapor pressure listed in Table 6.3 are defined for air over a JJ NN of fresh NN and are the basis for computing relative humidity ( Chapter 6 ) . The saturation vapor pressure increases with increasing curvature ( and decreasing droplet size ) . For droplets having a radius of 0.001 micrometer , the saturation vapor pressure at a given NN is about 3.4 times that specified in Table 6.3 , which computes to a relative humidity of 340 % . On the other hand , for droplets having a radius greater than 1.0 micrometer , the difference between the saturation vapor pressure surrounding the droplet and the values listed in Table 6.3 is minimal and computes to a relative humidity only slightly higher than 100 % . The bottom line : In clean air , NN vapor will not condense into tiny NN droplets unless the air is supersaturated to very high levels . In the real atmosphere , the relative humidity never RB approaches such great supersaturation values , so tiny droplets cannot form or grow . What then makes cloud formation possible ? The clean - air chamber experiment described above failed to produce a cloud because the air was not sufficiently supersaturated . In the real atmosphere , supersaturated air is not needed for clouds to develop ; in fact , cloud droplets readily form as the relative humidity nears 100 % . And clouds are abundant ; at any given NN , about 60 % of the NN is shrouded in clouds . How then , do cloud droplets form ? The answer : they have a head start . Suspended in air are solid and liquid particles that provide relatively JJ NN areas on which condensation or deposition initially takes place . These naturally occurring particles that promote condensation or deposition in the atmosphere are VBN as nuclei . Nuclei have radii greater than 1.0 micrometer and favor condensation ( or deposition ) of NN vapor . Once condensation ( or deposition ) starts , they become comparably sized cloud droplets ( or NN crystals ) . Additional growth of these droplets ( or NN crystals ) by condensation ( or deposition ) is more likely because they can grow in an environment with a relative humidity that exceeds 100 % by only 1 % or so . Most cloud particles have radii of 2 to CD micrometers . ­­ Nuclei , essential for cloud formation , are abundant in the atmosphere and are continually cycled into the atmosphere from NNP ’s NN . Sources of nuclei include volcanic eruptions , wind erosion of soil , forest fires , and ocean spray . When NN waves break , drops of salt NN enter the atmosphere and the NN evaporates leaving behind tiny sea-salt crystals that function as nuclei ( Figure 7.2 ) . NNS from domestic and industrial chimneys RB contribute nuclei to the atmosphere . Depending on the product ( liquid NN droplets or NN crystals ) , a distinction is made between cloud condensation nuclei and NN - forming nuclei . Cloud condensation nuclei ( CCN ) promote condensation of NN vapor at NNS both above and below the freezing point of NN . Within the atmosphere , NN vapor can condense into cloud droplets that remain liquid RB at NNS well below 00 C ( 320 F ) . Droplets at such NNS are described as supercooled . NN - forming nuclei ( IN ) are much less common than CCNs and promote formation of NN crystals only at NNS well below freezing . The most efficient NN - forming nuclei are substances having a crystal structure similar to that of NN and most are almost insoluble in NN . Clayey soil particles are excellent NN - forming nuclei . The CD types of NN - forming nuclei are freezing nuclei and deposition nuclei . Freezing nuclei are particles on which NN vapor condenses and subsequently freezes ; they are active at NNS below about - 90 C ( 160 F ) . Hygroscopic nuclei are a special category of cloud condensation nuclei because they possess a chemical attraction for NN molecules . Condensation begins on hygroscopic nuclei at a relative humidity under 100 % . Magnesium chloride ( MgCl2 ) , a salt in sea-spray , can promote condensation at a relative humidity as low as 70 % ! Clouds form more efficiently where hygroscopic nuclei are abundant . JJ sources of hygroscopic nuclei exist in urban - industrial areas and this helps explain why localities downwind of JJ cities tend to be somewhat cloudier and rainier than upwind localities . The Metropolitan Meteorological Experiment ( METROMEX ) conducted in the 1970s demonstrated that the average summer rainfall was 5 % to 25 % greater within , and up to 50 to 75 km ( 31 to 47 mi ) downwind of St. Louis , MO than upwind of the city . In more recent NNS , similar urban effects on precipitation were detected in Tokyo , Phoenix , and other cities . Besides being a source of hygroscopic nuclei , cities RB spur cloud and precipitation development by contributing NN vapor ( raising the relative humidity ) and heat ( adding to the buoyancy of air ) . Furthermore , the relative roughness of a city NN induces convergence of horizontal winds , uplift of air , and expansional cooling ( Chapter 8 ) . Interestingly , not all NN crystals form on the traditional nuclei described above . While sampling NN crystals in cold clouds from aircraft , NNS discovered that the concentration of NN crystals is highly variable within the cloud and NN crystals are CD to 1,000 times more numerous than nuclei . This discrepancy is likely explained by the presence of fragments of NN crystals that break off during midair collisions . These NN fragments then function as additional nuclei . text: As the NNP continues to VB protest groups take to the streets and demand radical NN in how we treat our environment , calling for the end of fossil fuels and a push for renewable NN sources we have to ask yourself what are the trade offs , what real benefit will these so called greener and cleaner NN sources provide for us ? Well , if an article by Jason Hickel in Foreign Policy , with the sub - title “ If the NN is n’t careful , renewable NN MD become as destructive as fossil fuels . ” is anything to VB by there is very real reasons to be concerned ! Here is the opening few paragraphs from the article : The conversation about NN NN has been blazing ahead in recent months . Propelled by the school NN strikes and JJ movements IN Extinction Rebellion , a number of governments have declared a NN emergency , and progressive JJ parties are making plans — at last — for a rapid transition to clean NN under the banner of the Green NNP Deal . This is a welcome shift , and we VBP more of it . But a JJ problem is beginning to emerge that warrants our attention . Some proponents of the Green NNP Deal seem to VB that it will pave the NN to a utopia of “ green growth . ” Once we trade dirty fossil fuels for clean NN , there ’s no reason we can’t keep expanding the economy forever . This narrative MD seem reasonable enough at JJ glance , but there are good reasons to VB twice about it . CD of them has to do with clean NN itself . The phrase “ clean NN ” normally conjures up happy , innocent images of warm sunshine and fresh wind . But while sunshine and wind is obviously clean , the infrastructure we VBP to capture it is not . Far from it . The transition to renewables is VBG to require a dramatic increase in the extraction of metals and rare - NN minerals , with real ecological and JJ costs . In 2017 , the NNP Bank released a little - noticed report that offered the JJ comprehensive look at this question . It models the increase in material extraction that MD be required to build enough solar and wind utilities to produce an annual output of about 7 terawatts of electricity by 2050 . That ’s enough to VB roughly half of the JJ economy . By doubling the NNP Bank figures , we can estimate what it will take to VB all the NN to zero NNS — and the results are staggering : 34 CD metric tons of copper , 40 CD tons of lead , 50 CD tons of zinc , 162 CD tons of aluminum , and no less than 4.8 CD tons of iron . So the question is this , are we RB moving to cleaner and greener forms of NN sources , or are we merely creating JJ problems to remove another ? Material extraction is a costly business , both financially and more importantly environmentally . text: The summer of 1540 was burning hot in the vine - covered hills of Burgundy , France — so hot as to be “ almost unbearable , ” according to CD written account from the NN . In fact , it was hot all across Europe that NN . In the Alps , glaciers melted , their snouts retreating up steep - sided valleys . Fires burned from France to Poland . And in the wine country of central France , the grapes withered to raisins on the vine , so the wine made from them was syrupy and extra-alcoholic . Normally , winemakers harvested grapes at the very end of September or early October . But that NN , they had to scurry to VB overripe grapes off the vine weeks earlier than usual . Now , a nearly 700 - NN - JJ record of harvest dates from the town of Beaune , in Burgundy , shows that early harvest dates IN the NN from 1540 are now par for the course , thanks to NN NN . NNS and historians stitched together a record of grape harvest dates VBG back to 1354 . They VBD that air NNS have warmed so much — and especially in the last 30 NNS — that grapes are now harvested almost CD weeks before their historical norm . “ We can clearly VB the reaction of the grapes to the rise in NN , ” VBZ Thomas Labbé , an historian at the NNP of Leipzig . And that reaction is changing the wine itself . Wine , in Burgundy , is built into the fabric of the culture . The pinot noir and chardonnay grapes the region is VBN for have been growing there and adapting to the precise NN conditions of the region for centuries . Winemakers VBP the growth stages intimately : the look of the vines before they bud ; the look of the vines as they mature over JJ seasons ; and the fat , sugary , fragrant curve of the grapes when they ’re ready to be made into wine . That harvest point is crucial . Too RB on the vine and the grapes have too much sugar in them , meaning the wine will be more alcoholic — not the subtle feel most winemakers in the region care for . Too RB , and the acids that give wine some of its feel in the mouth MD disintegrate . Not RB enough , and they might not have developed the JJ balance of fragrant chemicals that give the wine its characteristic flavours . Winemakers keep careful track of harvest dates , with some records stretching back to the Middle Ages . In the 1800s , NNS and historians realised that those careful records MD be VBN to keep track of how the NN in JJ parts of Europe has changed over NN . “ Grape harvest date records are the longest records of phonology in Europe , ” VBZ Elizabeth Wolkovich , a biologist at the NNP of British Columbia who studies wine and NN relationships . “ We have these hundreds of NNS of records of what the summer temp was JJ , and we can use them IN a thermometer . ” Grape harvest dates reflect the NN the grapes have felt over the course of the growing season , from about April until they ’re picked . If the spring and summer are hot , the grapes mature faster and VBP to be picked sooner . If they 're cool , the opposite is JJ . NN historians started to pull together ancient NN from other sources , too . They matched up the patterns in the grape harvest NNS with records made from tree rings and the length of glaciers in the Alps . They VBD records IN those to figure out that much of central Europe warmed up during the Medieval Warm Period , from IN 900 to 1300 . It had cooled down during the Little NNP Age , from about the 15th to the 19th centuries . The historians saw that over the past few hundred NNS , NNS wobbled RB , skewing warm for short stretches and cooling down in others . But overall , NN rocked up and down IN a fairly consistent average value — until recently .

text: ( CNN ) The NNP is heading toward a " JJ tipping point " if the NN NN continues on its current path , NNS have warned , as they called for urgent NN to avoid " an existential threat to civilization . " The group of researchers , who published a commentary in the journal Nature , VBP there is growing NN to suggest that irreversible NNS to the NNP 's JJ systems are already taking place , and that we are now in a " NN of planetary emergency . " A JJ tipping point is a threshold when the NN 's systems VBP beyond the point of no return -- such as the loss of the Amazon rainforest , accelerated melting of NN sheets , and thawing of permafrost -- the authors of the commentary VBP . Such a collapse MD lead to " hothouse " conditions that MD make some areas on NNP uninhabitable . " We argue that the intervention NN left to prevent tipping MD already have shrunk towards zero , whereas the reaction NN to achieve net zero NNS is 30 NNS at best , " the authors VBD . Led by Timothy Lenton , professor of NN NN and NNP NN NN at the NNP of Exeter , in southwest England , the team identified nine areas where they VBP tipping points are already underway . The team claims that these events are interconnected and NN in PRP will impact another , causing a worsening " cascade " of crises . The researchers VBD early results from preliminary models suggest the NN is much more sensitive than JJ thought and that a JJ tipping point is possible . " Research last NN analyzed 30 types of regime shift spanning physical NN and ecological systems , from collapse of the West Antarctic NN sheet to a switch from rainforest to savanna , " they added . " This indicated that exceeding tipping points in CD NN can increase the NN of crossing them in others . " The idea of a NN tipping point is not JJ . The UN Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP ( IPCC ) introduced the concept 20 NNS ago . Back then , the UN suggested such " JJ - scale discontinuities " MD only come about when JJ NN exceeded 5 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels . But the authors VBP NNS from the CD most recent IPCC reports in 2018 and September 2019 , suggest tipping points can happen between 1 C and 2 C of NN . The model highlighted the consequences of how the interactions between a variety of NN NN factors , such as the loss or weakening of NN sinks , forest dieback , NN retreat and increased bacteria respiration , MD combine to form a feedback loop which accelerates NN NN . The authors acknowledge that there are limits to their understanding of NN tipping , and further investigation is needed . But they VBP the possible impact MD be so huge and " irreversible " that " to err on the side of danger is not a responsible option . " In other words , not acting is " too risky to bet against " in their view . And NN is of the essence . Hope is not lost , however . Researchers VBP that mitigating NN gas NNS MD still slow down the accumulation of these NN impacts . What is needed , they VBP , is urgent international NN to cut NNS , slow NN level rise , and to keep NN to 1.5 C . " A saving grace is that the rate at which damage accumulates from tipping -- and hence the NN posed -- MD still be under our NN to some extent , " they VBD . " The stability and resilience of our NN is in peril . International NN -- not just words -- must reflect this . "

text: NOAA NN : Increase in particles high in NNP ’s atmosphere has offset some recent NN NN A recent increase in the abundance of particles high in the atmosphere has offset about a third of the current NN NN influence of NN dioxide ( CO2 ) NN during the past decade , according to a JJ NN led by NOAA and published today in the JJ edition of NNP . In the stratosphere , NNS above NNP ’s NN , JJ , airborne particles reflect sunlight back into NN , which leads to a cooling influence at the ground . These particles are RB called “ aerosols , ” and the JJ paper explores their recent NN effects — the reasons behind their increase remain the subject of ongoing research . “ Since the NN 2000 , stratospheric aerosols have caused a slower rate of NN NN than we MD have seen without them , ” VBZ John Daniel , a physicist at the NOAA NNP NNP Research Laboratory ( ESRL ) in Boulder , Colo . and an author of the JJ NN . In fact they VBP that the NN is rapid and doubled in the decade : They then admit they do n’t VB the source of these aerosols but give this speculation : Introducing aerosols into the upper atmosphere is call SRM for Solar Radiation Management . Here is the Huges patent describing how it is done : ( Link ) A method is disclosed for reducing atmospheric NN due to the NN effect resulting from a NN gases layer . The method comprises the step of seeding the NN gas layer with a quantity of tiny particles of materials … Such materials can include the class of materials VBN as Welsbach materials . The oxides of metal , e.g. , aluminum oxide , are RB suitable for the purpose . CD technique proposed to seed the metallic particles was to add the tiny particles to the fuel of jet airliners , so that the particles MD be emitted from the jet engine exhaust while the airliner was at its cruising altitude . Here is an extensive report on how to do it and how much it MD cost : Aurora Report So NOAA is showing these aerosols are mysteriously appearing in the upper atmospher , admit they do n’t VB why … yet there is lots of active JJ NN to spread these same aerosols ….. hmmmm …. So if it ’s in the air , are we seeing it fall to the ground ? I mean if they are spraying aluminum we MD VB it affecting plants and animals RB ? Extremely high quantities of aluminum , barium , strontium , and other metals and chemicals are showing up in rainwater , NN NN and air . In just the last four NNS , citizens in the Pacific Northwest ( Northern CA , Oregon ) have taken dozens of tests where the levels of aluminum , for example , has escalated hundreds of times from the JJ tests , which were already unusually high . Some tests of single rain events had elevated nearly 50,000 % from the original 7 ppb . These tests correspond with the NN of California ’s own test results … This NNS matches NNS from other citizen and JJ groups testing nationwide as well as Europe . Dangerous levels of aluminum , barium and other contaminants have saturated most NN waters in much of the US and all NATO NNS . The metals VBD exactly match the primary elements listed in a host of “ geo-engineering patents ” Patents ( assigned to Hughes Aircraft , DOD , Raytheon , and others ) describe the specific goal of creating artificial cloud cover ( reflecting , therefore cooling ) , and other forms of NN / NN modification . The California Air Quality Resources Board has studied aerosols migrating from NNP and these rainwater and air metals ( matching the patents ) are not present in rain or air approaching our continent . The contamination begins on - shore , though clearly just off - shore as well . Recent soil testing and analysis reveals that soil PH ’s are now changing tremendously . A number of studies VBP conclusively that bio-available aluminum is highly detrimental to countless organisms , including conifers .. Sierra Nevada firs have died or begun dying by the stands , RB in riparian areas where they never lack NN . text: While we have been hearing about this kind of thing for a while now , it is about to become reality . A group of Harvard NNS are VBG to be working to fight NN NN in a very interesting NN . The attempts they will be making MD drastically VB things . Basically , they will be VBG JJ sprays to reflect sunlight artificially and in doing this work to reduce the NN . While the idea is controversial at best if it works , we might be able to VB real NNS . This project is called Stratospheric Controlled Perturbation Experiment ( SCoPEx ) and will be about three CD dollars RB off the bat just for testing . Through this experiment , Harvard officials hope to advance their understandings on stratospheric aerosols in general so that it can be determined whether they are actually useful or not . It is thought that these researchers will be able to reduce their levels of uncertainty and determine the risks and benefits of solar geoengineering . If these sprays MD potentially eliminate or reduce our ozone loss in the JJ run without risks , we might have a good solution for now . Harvard wrote as follows on the experiment itself : At the heart of SCoPEx is a propelled scientific balloon that can travel a few meters per second ( walking speed ) relative to the surrounding air . The propellers serve CD functions . RB , the propeller wake forms a well - mixed volume ( roughly 1 km JJ and 100 meters in diameter ) that serves as an experimental ‘ beaker ’ in which we can add gasses or particles . Second , the propellers allow us to fly the gondola back and forth through the volume to measure the properties of the perturbed air . The advantage of the SCoPEx propelled balloon is that it allows us to create a JJ controlled volume of stratospheric air and observe its evolution for ( we hope ) over 24 hours . Hence the acronym , Stratospheric Controlled Perturbation Experiment . If we VBD an aircraft instead of a balloon , we MD not be able to use such a JJ perturbed volume nor MD we be able to observe it for such JJ durations . SCoPEx builds on four decades of research on the JJ chemistry of the ozone layer in the Anderson / Keith / Keutsch groups . SCoPEx will use or adapt JJ of the high - performance sensors and flight - NN engineering experience developed for this ozone research . Analyzing these experiments will improve our NN beyond what is currently available within computer models or is measurable with confidence under laboratory conditions . For this experiment , frozen NN will be released or so researchers NN . This being for now until they move forward and release calcium carbonate and other minerals . This whole operation is according to a release funded by the internal Harvard research funds that are provided by Professor David Keith and Frank Keutsch as well as Harvard ’s Solar Geoengineering Research Program . We do not VB what results will be obtained through this but researchers VBP they have a good idea of what will come . According to Forbes , the basis IN this experiment is from studying the effects of JJ volcanic eruptions on the NN ’s NN . Because computer models can only VB so far taking this out into the field and giving it a NN is the next step . This geoengineering technique MD RB VB things . That being VBN , some studies suggest that spraying sunlight reflective particles into the atmosphere MD have lots of consequences and kill off crops or VB NN patterns at the very least . text: A growing number of Dutch Catholic are now turning to populist politicians and parties and rejecting Pope Francis 's warnings of its dangers . Populist legislator Thierry Baudet last week “ surged into the Dutch JJ mainstream as the biggest winner in nationwide elections . " According to Katholiek Nieuwsblad , he is the “ the JJ face of Dutch populism , ” appealing to JJ Catholics who have felt politically homeless . Baudet is against mass migration , skeptical of NN NN , and an outspoken critic of the “ cartel party , ” in reference to the elite Dutch JJ establishment . [ RELATED ] 4.2 CD Americans Abandon The Catholic Church In Protest Of Pope Francis Earlier this NN , Francis blamed the shortcomings of globalization on the rapid rise of nationalism . Francis did not highlight any specific NNS of JJ parties but reflected on national policies favoring " quick partisan consensus " over patient efforts for the common good . The Pontiff expressed worry that Europe and North NNP are limiting their acceptance to migrants in his speech to diplomats accredited to the Vatican . Three Dutch practicing Catholics were interviewed by Katholiek Nieuwsblad , who VBD they sympathize with Forum for Democracy - as the newspaper describes a JJ member , a ‘ dormant ’ member and an active member of the party . The JJ member , Michiel Hemminga , is a philosopher and pro-life who is sympathetic to JJ of the party ’s positions , but critical of others . According to Breitbart : Forum for Democracy suffers from a certain ambiguity in its platform , Hemminga VBD , and some of its positions are untenable for a Catholic . While their opposition to overreaching from the European Union ( EU ) and unchecked migration is open and a viable option for Catholics , on other issues tensions cannot VB but arise . “ According to CD of the party ’s plans , at a certain point all religious NNS should agree to the fact that the Dutch law is above their own religious beliefs , ” Hemminga VBD . “ For me , as a Christian , that ’s not an option . I ’m not suddenly VBG to support gay marriage or abortion , because it ’s the law . ” Erik van Goor , a Catholic convert , publicist , and blogger is an early member of Forum for Democracy , who has hopes that the party will be able to shake up the current JJ NN . “ When I understood that a JJ party was in the making , I was very enthusiastic about it . I do n’t VB what the future holds for the party , but I do VB the current NN needs a breakthrough . Geert Wilders has n’t been able to do that , but I hope Forum for Democracy will , ” he VBD . “ NNS are becoming more and more secular and liberal , ” van Goor VBD . “ We run the NN of living in a NN where you cannot VB or VB anything that is opposed by the mainstream NN . ” Forum for Democracy draws JJ NNS who worry about the whole “ gender craze , ” he VBD , attracting JJ conservatives “ who feel abandoned by a liberal left policy . ” Another convert to Catholicism , Zlata Brouwer is a “ dormant ” member of Forum for Democracy , who appreciated the party ’s commitment to preserving Dutch culture . “ When I received my religious education , I studied the moral and cultural roots of our Western culture and how they are intertwined , ” Brouwer VBD . “ But we throw away our own culture . Although Forum for Democracy is not a Christian party , I VBP it ’s the only party who tries to preserve our culture , our democracy , for future generations , ” she VBD . Although there are positions espoused by Baudet that she disagrees with , as a whole , she finds him more convincing than the other candidates . “ I do n’t VB he ’s acknowledging the JJ origin of what he likes to preserve . My hope is that CD day he will , perhaps if he gets married and starts a family , ” she VBD . “ You VBP only to look at the history books to realize that the traditional marriage and the family are essential to all things created within a culture . ” [ RELATED ] Pope Francis Calls on Migrants to Flood the US : ' Forget National Security '

text: Mass Extinction , ' Great Dying ' MD Wipe Out NN on NNP , NNPS Warn NNS are warning that naturally occurring JJ NN was behind the largest mass extinction event on NNP , and our NN MD be due for another huge wipeout . Researchers have shown that the Great Dying , which killed almost all of NNP 's ocean creatures IN 250 CD NNS ago , was caused by rising JJ temperates . text: A green fund is a mutual fund or another investment vehicle that will only invest in NNS that are deemed socially conscious in their business dealings or directly promote JJ responsibility . A green fund can come in the form of a focused investment vehicle for NNS engaged in environmentally supportive businesses , such as alternative NN , green transport , NN and waste management , and sustainable living . A green fund 's strategy can be VBN on some of the following characteristics : avoiding negative NN criteria ( businesses such as guns , alcohol , gambling , pornography , animal testing , etc. ) ; choosing positive NN criteria ( JJ programs , NN conservation , fair trade , etc. ) ; or a combination of both strategies . VBN on performance , it is not yet clear whether green funds and socially responsible investing ( SRI ) can consistently create better returns for investors , but they do represent a proactive step toward JJ consciousness , which JJ investors VBP as valuable . Some have cited green investing as having begun in earnest during the 1990s , a period where investors were more seriously taking into account the harm businesses or the pressure entire industries were putting on the environment . In the wake of headline - grabbing events IN the Exxon Valdez oil spill , and JJ and protracted fights over logging rights in the Pacific Northwest , a set of investors began to view businesses that were better at managing their JJ impact as more valuable than those who MD n't . These types of businesses , in some investors ' eyes , were not only operating in a more ethical manner but had a competitive advantage over NNS who were ill - equipped to reduce their impact on the environment . Still , other investors saw an ethical obligation in investing in technologies and businesses that were looking to build a sustainable society through renewable NN sources . Some of the sectors where this investment has been taking place include the renewable NN , and buildings and efficiency sector . The renewable NN sector is a broad NN , including solar NN , wind , battery , and NN storage technologies , as well as the materials that VBP make those technologies possible . The buildings sector includes builders who use NN - efficient materials , making each building 's NN footprint smaller – whether they 're being VBN for commercial , residential , or office use . Socially conscious investing has continued to gain popularity , which is due largely to increased worldwide exposure to the issue of NN NN , as well as increased federal funding for alternative NN and other programs . Since 2007 , the Green Transition Scoreboard , a project run by Ethical Markets NNP and The NNP Prosperity Alliance , has tracked $ 8.1 trillion invested in the green economy through the end of CD , more than halfway to the goal of $ CD trillion invested by 2020 . Some of the green mutual funds that are available include the TIAA - CREF NNP Choice Equity Fund ( TICRX ) ; Portfolio 21 NNP Equity Fund Class R ( PORTX ) 21 ; and the Green Century balanced ( GCBLX ) . NN has poured into green funds as investors seek both socially responsible investments and returns from the uptick in green technologies such as wind and solar NN . Inflows into socially conscious funds quadrupled to more than $ 4.3 trillion from 2012 to 2014 , with the number of funds growing by 28 % . Despite sometimes high fees , the funds have RB garnered relatively solid performance . Socially responsible funds returned 8.1 % versus 8.4 % for non-socially responsible funds over the three NNS ended March 31 , 2018 . For the CD NNS ended on March 31 , 2018 , the funds turned in 8.91 % versus 9.1 % for their non-socially responsible peers .

text: Satellite NN Show Amazon Rainforest Likely Drier , More Fire - Prone This NN Huge swaths of Brazil ’s Amazon rainforest are drier than usual after a rainy season with rainfall index well below historical levels , raising concerns about a further spike in wildfires and deforestation as the dry season approaches . NNS from NNP and the Brazilian National Institute for NNP Research ( INPE ) points to stressed NN conditions : the soil is drier , NNS are higher , and groundwater is depleted . Peak rainy season , which runs from December to February , was among the top CD worst on record this NN , with just 75 % of the season ’s usual rainfall . Last NN , wildfire and deforestation in the Amazon hit the highest levels in a decade . But the flames were contained by the rainforest ’s natural humidity after several months of intense rainfall . This NN , the rainforest MD not be so lucky . Since taking office in January 2019 , Brazil ’s NNP Jair Bolsonaro has scaled back JJ protections and pushed to VB the country ’s legislation to open up indigenous reserves to mining and other development activities that are the main drivers of Amazon destruction . The NN has RB cut down on JJ raids amid the NN - CD NN , opening the doors to increased deforestation , wildcat mining and land grabbing . As a result , deforestation this NN increased 51 % through March compared to the JJ quarter of 2019 , according to INPE . The deforestation figure for August 2019 to the end of March 2020 is reportedly nearly twice that of the same period a NN earlier . Adding a drier NN to the mix , experts warn , MD be lethal for the forest , intensifying forest dieback and allowing more untouched , healthy forest to catch fire in the JJ term . Although NN forecasts for the Amazon are highly unpredictable , which MD potentially reverse the current deficit , NN models by Brazil ’s Center for NNP Forecasting and NNP Research ( CPTEC ) show no indication of above - average precipitation in the coming months . “ We are entering a drier season where rains are not [ usually ] intense enough to impact the potential for fire and other factors related to the dry season , ” CPTEC climatologist Diego Jatobá VBD Mongabay . NN shortages in the soil RB after a rainy season RB signal trouble later on in the NN , VBZ NNP scientist and hydrologist Matthew Rodell , who works with NNP ’s Gravity Recovery and NN Experiment Follow - On ( GRACE - FO ) satellites monitoring NN levels stored deep beneath the NNP ’s NN . Their NNS are VBN to predict drought worldwide . Recent GRACE -FO images of South NNP have shown JJ areas of Brazil ’s Amazon and Cerrado biomes in the deep red zone , meaning NN levels are severely impacted . “ If we VBP normal to low precipitation this NN , then there is potential for drought , ” Rodell VBD Mongabay in a telephone interview . “ I MD be concerned . ” But for Ane Alencar , the head of the Amazon NNP Research Institute ( IPAM ) and a specialist in rainforest wildfires , an increase in fires this NN depends far more on JJ decisions than NN conditions , which she expects will be within an average range . “ I have the worst possible expectations about uncontrolled JJ - induced deforestation and fire ignition this NN . Spontaneous combustion does n’t exist in the Amazon , ” she VBD Mongabay . A technical report by IPAM published this week RB anticipates a surge in fires caused by the deforestation spike of 2019 , as the modus operandi of land grabbers is to deforest CD NN then set fire the next , in order to successfully transform forest into farmland and pastures . Drier soil conditions overlap with high deforestation rates . In northern Pará NN , home to 40 % of all deforestation in the Brazilian Amazon last NN , early fires MD happen , NN maps show . In the area IN the city of Santarém , which already has the highest deforestation rates in the Amazon , fires and land clearing MD RB spike after the recent paving of the BR - 163 highway that cuts through the Amazon rainforest , described by Bolsonaro on NNP as “ at the heart of agribusiness . ” The gradual drying of the Amazon has concerned NNS for decades , as it threatens to set off a cycle of forest dieback that MD push the rainforest over its tipping point , turning rainforest into degraded savanna . In recent NNS , extreme NN events IN droughts and floods have increased and published NNS show dry seasons getting longer and more severe . But figures on the Amazon rainy season are JJ . According to rainfall NNS shared with Mongabay by CPTEC , eight of the CD driest rainy seasons in Brazil ’s northern region recorded since 1962 happened after the NN 2000 . “ We have observed a negative trend , a significant sign of reduction in rain through the NNS , ” CPTEC scientist Jatobá VBD Mongabay . Nevertheless , there is still some hope for reversing the current scenario . According to Nepstad , some steps are already being taken by a part of the agribusiness sector to encourage farmers to plant trees . “ Farmers are on the hook to plant 6 CD hectares ( 14.8 CD acres ) in the next 20 NNS , but they often do n’t have enough NN or incentives to do this . This is part of the solution , ” he VBD .

text: Calls for an independent inquiry into what is being dubbed “ Climategate ” are growing as the foundation for man-made JJ NN implodes following the release of emails which prove researchers colluded to manipulate NNS in order to “ hide the decline ” in JJ NNS . JJ British chancellor Lord Lawson was the latest to demand an impartial investigation be launched into the scandal , which arrives just weeks before the UN NN conference in Copenhagen . “ They should set up a JJ inquiry under someone who is totally respected and VB to the truth , ” he VBD the BBC Radio Four Today programme . The emails were leaked at the end of last week after hackers penetrated the servers of the Climatic Research Unit , which is VBN at the NNP of East Anglia , in eastern England . The CRU is described as CD of the leading NN research bodies in the NN . The hacked documents and communications reveal how top NNS conspired to falsify NNS in the face of declining JJ NNS in order to prop up the premise that man-made factors are driving NN NN . Others illustrate how they embarked on a venomous and coordinated campaign to ostracize NN skeptics and use their influence to keep dissenting reports from appearing in peer - reviewed journals , as well as VBG cronyism to avoid compliance with Freedom of NNP Act requests . As expected , the establishment NN has gone into whitewash overdrive , characterizing the emails as NN of “ rancor ” amongst the NN community and focusing on some of the lesser emails while ignoring the JJ significance of what has been revealed . Organizations with close ties to the CRU have engaged in psychological terrorism by fearmongering about the NN with doomsday scenarios , illustrating their argument with outlandish propaganda animation videos which show pets drowning and others that show computer - generated polar bears crashing to NN in a throwback to 9/11 victims jumping from the towers , when in reality polar bear population figures are thriving . “ CD of the emails under scrutiny , written by Phil Jones , the centre ’s director , in 1999 , reads : “ I ’ve just completed Mike ’s Nature [ the NN journal ] trick of adding in the real temps to each series for the last 20 NNS ( ie , from 1981 onwards ) and from 1961 for Keith ’s to hide the decline , ” reports the London Telegraph . The author admitted to the Associated Press that the e mail was genuine . In another example , researchers discuss NN that is “ artificially adjusted to look closer to the real NNS ” . Apparently , the “ real NNS ” are whatever JJ NN cheerleaders VBP them to be . As Anthony Watts writes , attempts to claim e mails are “ out of context , ” as the defense has been from CRU , cannot apply in this instance . You can claim an email you wrote NNS ago is n’t accurate saying it was “ taken out of context ” , but a programmer making notes in the code does so that he / she can document what the code is actually doing at that stage , so that anyone who looks at it later can figure out why this function does n’t plot past 1960 . In this NN , it is not allowing all of the NN NNS to be plotted . Growing season NNS ( summer months when the JJ tree rings are formed ) past 1960 is thrown out because “ these will be artificially adjusted to look closer to the real NNS ” , which implies some post processing routine . Spin that , spin it to the NN if you VBP . I ’ll VB programmer notes over the word of somebody who stands to gain from suggesting there ’s nothing “ untowards ” about it . Either the NNS tells the story of nature or it does not . NN that has been “ artificially adjusted to look closer to the real NNS ” is JJ NNS , yielding a JJ result . Another email discusses changing NN NNS to fix “ blips ” in studies so as to make them conform with expectations , which of course is the cardinal sin of scientific research . “ NN , collusion in exaggerating NN NNS , possibly illegal destruction of embarrassing NN , organized resistance to disclosure , manipulation of NNS , private admissions of flaws in their JJ claims and much more ” was revealed in the 61 megabites of confidential files released on the Internet for anyone to read , writes Andrew Bolt . Another email appears to celebrate the death of NN NN skeptic John L Daly , with the words , “ In an odd NN this is cheering NN . ” In another communication , the author expresses his fantasy to “ beat the crap out of ” NN NN skeptics . In another exchange , researchers appear to discuss ways to discredit James Saiers of the Geophysical Research Letters journal , by means of an academic witch hunt , because of his sympathies with NN NN skeptics . “ If you VBP that Saiers is in the NN skeptics camp , then , if we can find documentary NN of this , we MD VB through official AGU channels to VB him ousted . ” Other emails express doubt about whether the NN is RB heating up and infer that NNS needs to be reinterpreted . “ The fact is that we ca n’t account for the lack of NN at the moment and it is a travesty that we can ’t . The CERES NNS published in the August BAMS 09 supplement on 2008 shows there should be RB more NN : but the NNS are surely wrong . Our observing NN is inadequate . ” NNS discuss trying to disguise historical NNS that contradicts the man-made NN NN thesis , such as the Medieval Warm Period ( MWP ) , which must be ‘ contained ’ according to CD email . Suppression of NN is RB discussed , with NNS resolving to delete embarrassing emails . “ And , perhaps most reprehensibly , ” writes James Delingpole , a JJ series of communications discussing how best to squeeze dissenting NNS out of the peer review process . How , in other words , to create a scientific NN in which anyone who disagrees with AGW can be written off as a crank , whose views do not have a scrap of authority . ” “ This was the danger of always criticising the skeptics for not publishing in the “ peer - reviewed literature ” . Obviously , they VBD a solution to that –take over a journal ! So what do we do about this ? I VBP we have to stop considering “ NNP Research ” as a legitimate peer - reviewed journal . Perhaps we should encourage our colleagues in the NN research community to no longer submit to , or cite papers in , this journal . We MD RB VB to consider what we tell or request of our more reasonable colleagues who currently sit on the editorial board … What do others VB ? ” “ I will be emailing the journal to tell them I ’m having nothing more to do with it until they rid themselves of this troublesome editor . ” “ It results from this journal having a number of editors . The responsible NN for this is a well - VBN skeptic in NZ . He has let a few papers through by Michaels and Gray in the past . I ’ve had words with Hans von Storch about this , but got nowhere . Another thing to discuss in Nice ! ” NNS RB “ discussed ways of dodging Freedom of NNP Act requests to release NN NNS , ” reports the Daily Mail . The emails show that NNS relied on cronyism and cosying up to FOIA officials to prevent them from being forced to release NNS . “ When the FOI requests began here , the FOI person VBD we had to abide by the requests , ’ the email VBZ . “ It took a couple of half - hour sessions to convince them otherwise . ” “ Once they became aware of the types of NNS we were dealing with , everyone at UEA became very supportive . I ’ve got to VB the FOI person quite well and the chief librarian – who deals with appeals . ” It is important to stress that this compendium merely scratches the NN of the monumental levels of fraud that have been exposed as a result of the hacked emails . NNS will look back on this moment as the beginning of the end for JJ NN alarmism and the agenda to implement draconian measures of regulation and NN along with the levy of a JJ NN tax . text: The JJ strike on Friday September 20 , 2019 was the largest demonstration for NN NN in history . The movement that started with Swedish teenager Greta Thunberg in August 2018 has now mobilised millions , while Extinction Rebellion and other protest groups have escalated their campaigns on streets IN the NN . From the efforts of activists in JJ NNS , radical “ Green JJ Deals ” are emerging as a bold , JJ response to the NN NN . “ The NN is waking up , ” Thunberg VBD NN leaders at the recent UN NNP NNP Summit . “ And NN is coming whether you VBP it or not . ” But how RB that awakening takes MD be decisive for NN this century . A report published ahead of the summit declared that the impacts of NN NN are accelerating – growth rates of NN dioxide ( CO₂ ) in the atmosphere were nearly 20 % higher in the 2015 - CD period than the previous five NNS , while the average rate of NN level rise has increased to 5 mm per NN over roughly the same period . CD author warned that limiting JJ NN rise to 2 °C MD require tripling current commitments to reduce NNS . To hold NNS at 1.5 °C above pre-industrial levels , JJ ambition MD VB to increase by a factor of five . The debate over whether NN NN is happening is over , and the conversation about what should be done is beginning in earnest . As such , for the past few weeks , we ’ve asked experts from IN the NN to describe how the NN should respond to the threat of NN breakdown . We share their insights here . The NN of the NNP Nowhere are the effects of NN NN more visible than in the Arctic – a region that ’s estimated to be VBG at least twice as fast as the JJ average . Arctic NN NN reached its second - lowest extent on record in September 2019 – a mere 1.6 m square NNS . A JJ report by the Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP ( IPCC ) has revealed the NNS that are underway in the oceans and the NN - covered regions of the NN , and the message is stark . “ Glaciers and NN sheets are shrinking . JJ NN level is rising at more than twice the rate of the 20th century . The ocean is NN , becoming more acidic and losing oxygen . Fifty percent of coastal wetlands have been lost over the past 100 NNS . NNS are shifting , biodiversity is declining and ecosystems are losing their integrity and function . ” NNP ’s oceans have absorbed more than 90 % of the excess heat in the JJ NN NN , but not without repercussions . Marine heatwaves are causing coral reefs to bleach and mass die - offs of fish and other wildlife . Not only does this added ocean heat wreak havoc on marine ecosystems , but it is changing the relationship between coastal communities and the ocean . Wildlife populations are struggling to adapt to the disruption , both in the oceans and on land . As a result , a landmark report from an international team of biodiversity experts earlier in 2019 called for “ transformative NN ” to economies and societies to prevent up to a CD NNS VBG extinct . Five steps to restrain NNS RB now “ The UK , Norway , Sweden and France have written a target of net - zero NNS into law , [ but ] targets are , by definition , a statement of nothing more than intent . In and of themselves , they do not remove a single molecule of NN dioxide from the atmosphere . ” Limiting JJ NN rise to 1.5 °C means the NN has to be at net - zero NN NNS by 2050 . But it ’s cumulative NNS that count – if NNS leave decarbonisation until the last minute , it will be too late . Rebecca Willis , a professor of NN and NN policy at Lancaster NNP in the UK , outlines five measures that can begin to restrain NNS RB now : • None Task all NN departments with a NN agenda so that they ’re obligated to show how their policies will contribute to NNS cuts . • None Engage the NN in developing NN strategies with citizens ’ assemblies and involve workers in designing policy to ensure a “ just transition ” from NN - intensive industries IN coal mining . • None Enact “ symbolic policies ” to set the investment NN and catalyse radical NN – ban advertising for petrol cars for instance , or allow NNS to generate and sell renewable NN at home . • None Keep all remaining fossil fuels in the ground – ban oil and gas exploration and end the US $ 5.2 trillion spent on subsidising the fossil fuel industry each NN . • None Set aside negative emission technologies – NN capture and storage might play a role in absorbing NN gases from the atmosphere in future , but they do n’t exist at a meaningful scale yet . Relying on them distracts resources from cutting NNS now . There are technologies that already exist which are very good at capturing CO₂ . Plants have perfected the process of turning NN in the air into solid , living material over billions of NNS . Natural NN solutions mobilise this potential by restoring forests , wetlands and other habitats . CD estimate from the UK suggests each hectare of JJ forest can absorb the annual NN NNS of 90 cars . But it ’s not as simple as letting nature do all the hard work , VBZ Sebastian Leuzinger , an associate professor at the Auckland NNP of Technology . The “ JJ tree should be planted at the JJ NN in the JJ place ” : • None Tree NNS that grow fast are able to store NN more rapidly , but slower , bigger trees will ultimately store more in the JJ run . • None Non-native trees MD be better at absorbing NN efficiently than native NNS , so keep an open NN to their role . • None When choosing a NN to plant , trust local foresters and the community that will have to live alongside and nurture them . Natural NN solutions can RB VB society adapt to the inevitable NNS ahead . Zita Sebesvari , head of JJ vulnerability and ecosystem services at NNP Nations NNP , argues that the value of rewilding here is CD - fold : removing the CO₂ that exacerbates NN NN while mitigating its impacts . How to feed the NN Leaving room for nature seems radical when NNS currently exploit more than 70 % of the NNP ’s NN - free NN , much of it to grow food . It ’s estimated that a third of all NN gas NNS originate with agriculture – from deforesting farmland to raising livestock that belch methane . Farming for meat and dairy can use up to 100 times the land area to produce a single gram of NN compared to beans , nuts and other plant sources . Little wonder that NNS are encouraged to eat less of it , and Alessandro Demaio , a fellow in JJ NN at the NNP of Copenhagen , recommends a “ planetary NN diet ” which involves reducing meat intake in Western NNS by 50 % . He RB calls for : • None Recycling organic waste as fertiliser and investing in agroforestry – where trees are grown IN crops to increase biodiversity . • None Breeding drought - resistant crop strains , making animal feed more nutritious and creating additives that can make livestock emit 30 % less methane . Sean Beer , a lecturer in agriculture at Bournemouth NNP , argues that eating more local and seasonal produce MD VB some NN to decarbonising agriculture . Reviving traditional food supply systems MD RB be key to guaranteeing sustainable diets for all , VBZ Jagannath Adhikari , a sessional lecturer at the NNP of NNP South Wales . In parts of the Himalayas , the answer to this problem is “ food forests ” . Local NNS plant useful trees and grow crops in the woodland near their homes , and protect what grows there naturally . They harvest what they VBP – mushrooms , honey , roots and edible plants – and sell any surplus at a NN . Since community rights were restored to forest management here , worrying trends in deforestation and poverty have been reversed . Some politicians are now supporting policies that address NN NN by transforming national economies under the umbrella of a Green NNP Deal . Spain ’s socialist party was recently reelected on a Green NNP Deal platform , for example , and , in the UK , the Labour Party has voted in favour of CD . The idea was born in the UK in 2007 , but has been gaining ground IN the NN lately , especially in the US where it has been championed by congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio - Cortez . Although the specifics vary , a Green NNP Deal involves JJ investments in clean NN sector jobs and infrastructure to decarbonise the economy and correct inequalities through job guarantees and universal basic services such as free JJ transport and healthcare . Governments MD RB be expected to slash or eliminate the billions they spend on subsidising the cost of fossil fuels . Experts RB urge for the inclusion of the insurance industry in Green NNP Deal discussions . A recent report from Cambridge NNP emphasised the JJ losses insurers will face under NN NN and warns that it MD spark a JJ financial NN . >“ If governments respond appropriately to the urgent warning issued by the Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP ( IPCC ) in October [ 2018 ] , efforts to phase out fossil fuels will have to ramp up considerably — and quickly . ” Already , there has been a slew of lawsuits against the largest fossil fuel NNS in an effort to hold them accountable for misleading the NN on the risks of NN NN while selling NNS that have contributed to it . Litigation , thus far , has not been successful , but the tide MD be turning . In the US , more than a dozen cities , counties and NNS are seeking damages from NN NNS for the the costs of NN NN , from retrofitting storm drains to upgrading NN walls . These lawsuits draw on litigation against tobacco NNS and on scientific research that attributes NN gas NNS to NN NNS . In the past , “ the plaintiffs had difficulties tracing NN harms to specific NNS made by particular corporations … Scientific research has evolved dramatically since then . ” VBZ Lisa Benjamin , from Lewis & Clark College of Law , in Portland , Oregon . For example , in Europe , a German NN has agreed to hear a Peruvian farmer ’s NN against the German NN giant RWE for its role in melting the glaciers near his hometown of Huaraz and raising the risks of landslides and flooding . A NN VBD RWE was responsible for 0.47 % of historic NNS , so the farmer is seeking 0.47 % of the cost for his community to adapt to NN NN . As the impacts of NN NN become more clear , Thunberg ’s not the only NN questioning the “ fairy tales of eternal JJ growth ” . Producing stuff consumes NN , and producing more stuff , whether it ’s fast fashion or smartphones , means the ongoing and growing consumption of NN . “ This makes it very hard to decarbonise the economy , ” VBZ Simon Mair at the NNP of Surrey . If we stopped chasing productivity growth , decarbonisation MD come easier , we ’d have less “ crap ” and we might start investing NN and JJ NN into good jobs that matter , IN teaching and nursing . The NN is finally listening to the experts Despite the potentially massive implications of a 2 °C rise in JJ NN , NN NN has remained low on the NN agenda . Journalists and their NN organisations have largely failed to give NN VB the attention it deserves and have failed to press JJ figures on NN issues and policies . NNS ago , NN journalists threw away the notion of putting scientific fact and NN denier opinion on equal ground . Other NNS are finally catching up and providing analysis and verification , and improving the scientific literacy of their audience . They are connecting NN NN to local stories , focusing on solutions ( instead of “ doom and gloom ” coverage ) and adjusting their language to describe the “ NN NN ” . These shifts in journalism MD yield more NN on NN NN . Young NNS tend to avoid negative NN headlines ; they do n’t VB their NN coverage to present a bleak and certain future . Instead , they VBP stories about the “ NN NN ” necessary to create zero- NN societies , VBZ Julie Doyle , from the NNP of Brighton . It ’s not that they ca n’t handle the bad NN , but that “ they wanted to be involved in rethinking socioeconomic systems , and are inspired and empowered by working together . ” That ’s why “ NN NN not NN NN ” has became the rallying cry of the young NN strikers . Thunberg ’s journey from a lonely vigil outside the Swedish parliament to a Nobel Peace Prize nominee at the head of a JJ movement took just over a NN . It seems the NN RB is waking up , but now comes the hard part – changing the systems that fuel the NN NN before it ’s too late . This article was amended on November 12 2019 to clarify an error . The earlier story VBD JJ NNS of NN dioxide grew by 20 % between 2015 and 2019 . Instead , growth rates of NN dioxide were nearly 20 % higher in the 2015 - CD period than the previous five NNS . text: ER Editor : We draw the reader ’s attention to a piece we published by Prof. Claudia von Werlhof from 2 NNS ago titled The NNP Is Not VBG Up But Drying Out ! Professor Claudia von Werlhof wrote to Greta Thunberg . ( VB featured image ) In this letter Von Werlhof VBZ that the disruption of the JJ NN is not due to CO2 . Questions arose from this letter for Silvia Terribili , who asked von Werlhof to give an interview for her radio show Onda Italiana on salto.nl , April 9th . Below is the transcript of the interview . Claudia Von Werlhof : The question is how we define NN NN and its alleged reason , of which it is VBN it is CO2 . We consider NN NN , at least in the official discussion , as “ JJ NN ” and this JJ NN does n’t exist . There are NNS from NNP , which is the North NNP NNP Agency , and they show that in the last 18 NNS there was no general JJ NN . What exist indeed – because we are not deniers of the problem – are NNS in JJ dimensions in the NN , in the NN and more so in the atmosphere , etc . We are VBG to explain this more in this interview . The second is the CO2 - question , which is now very prominent as all these young NNS are now on the street because they VBP in this story and this dogma of the CO2 . And this is very strange because a lot of NNS , real NNS , are denying the influence of CO2 as a reason for NN NN or as an influence at all . For example , there are about 30,000 NNS in the US now who VBP that there is no problem with CO2 . They VBP that CO2 is not at all detrimental for the NN , and that it RB is something we are to welcome and that we VBP for our trees and plants and as a positive effect . So , the funny thing is that CO2 is often shown as some dirt , as if it was a dirt in the air . Then you look at the factories that are shown in this opportunity , you VBP the dust coming out of them , etc . This is not CO2 . CO2 is a gas that is invisible and does n’t smell , so you do n’t VB it . In general , the amount of CO2 in the atmosphere is about . Most of that is vapour , NN vapour , some 80 or 70 % . So , all these NNS who are serious NNS , are denying a negative influence of CO2 on the NN . There are RB winners of the Nobel Prize etc. , IN Ivar Giaever , who are explaining it or NNS from the MIT , the Massachusetts Institute of Technology , IN Richard Lindzen and others . The IPCC , the International Panel on NNP NNP , founded at the end of the ’ 80s of the last century , however , is not so much a scientific but a JJ organization , and it is propagating and proposing the CO2 myth to the NN . So , this is a JJ question , and from the point of view of a real scientist , CO2 is not RB something detrimental and is not changing any NN . It ’s too tiny for that . If you look at the origins of this debate at the end of the ‘ 80s , you VBP that before this NN all the NN spoke about a possible NN age , a JJ NN age . Lowell Ponte , f.i. , wrote a book on “ The Cooling ” . It was in 1976 . They spoke about a cooling and a JJ NN age in contrast to the JJ NN - speech of today . There is no historical debate any more about how this myth about CO2 came about . The IPCC was founded by NNP Tanks IN the Club of Rome , the NNP Watch Institute , the Rockefellers , etc. , NNS who have a JJ interest in the whole question . And they VBD , I VBP it was an analysis by William Engdahl , who VBD they VBD or invented the myth of CO2 in order to have a common enemy defined which is humanity itself . Humanity is guilty of producing so much CO2 by civil industry and consumption . This ideology can be VBN for another , a JJ policy . So , this was the origin of the CO2 myth and this has been their propaganda worldwide . Then came NNP Gore and everybody believes in him . This is contrasting with the fact that This history is generally not VBN . And NNS do n’t RB VB anything about Nature and the NNP . There is a certain ignorance generally , and There are a lot of NNS in the NN , in the NN , in JJ aspects , IN those Dr. Rosalie Bertell VBD out , we ’ll speak about her later , who VBD we are wrecking our NN . But how ? It ’s not by JJ NN , but by something totally JJ . This is not mentioned by these NNS who speak about NN NN . They do n’t VB that there are NNS , but there are JJ ones with very JJ origins . Silvia Terribili : Yes , it seems RB that computer models predicting catastrophic JJ NN in the coming NNS are parameterized , and there is a NN of framing the outcome of these methods and models . Can you VB something about these models ? CvW : These models the IPCC is VBG are computer models . Their results are just an outcome of computer simulation . It has nothing to do with reality , and what they are measuring is what they VBP to measure . They just measure something IN more CO2 - output , but they do not consider the complexity of the NN on this NN . They have no parameters about them and so they are RB trying to fool us with what they are saying about such a JJ amount of NN NN and JJ NN . This is not happening , and it will not happen because of CO2 . So , these are strange methods , and not scientific ones . PRP should VB they are JJ methods which VBP to prove something which is not the NN . So , there is no reason why there should be such an amount of JJ NN of above 4 degrees , which is impossible . At least it is impossible with simply putting CO2 as a measure of this tiny amount of CO2 in the air . You MD never have any effect , and it is very funny that everybody is believing this nonsense . It ’s a NN , but it has nothing to do with reality , and we should look at why this NN exists . So , this is the more important question . ST : Some 30 NNS ago we were being warned that the protective ozone layer had been reduced . Nowadays we do n’t seem to care anymore about ozone depletion in the stratosphere . How MD this be explained because we have to be concerned about the depletion of the ozone layer and where it comes from . CvW : The ozone question , yes . This is a very funny thing again , and it is not funny at all in the end because the ozone layer is RB something that we VBP . Without the ozone layer there MD be no NN on NN , because it protects us from cosmic radiation from the NN , especially UV - B and - C radiation , which is very toxic . And it has been VBN that this radiation today is coming down to NN , which normally is prevented by the ozone layer . But now it comes through , and this is a JJ story because there was the Montreal Protocol in the ‘ 80s which prohibited the use of CFCs , all these chemicals you have in the refrigerators , etc. , because they thought it was the reason for the ozone hole . But this was already wrong then because we VBP that what was RB damaging the ozone was particularly radioactivity . Of radioactivity , there has been a lot in the air since the NN had been experimenting with nuclear explosions from the ‘ 40s and ‘ 50s until the end of the ‘ 90s , and we had about 2,200 nuclear explosions on NN and in the atmosphere , and This is the main reason for the weakness of this layer because radioactivity is somehow eating up the ozone so that it is suffocating in a NN , because ozone is a sort of atmospheric oxygen and radioactivity finishes the oxygen . The problem is something IN suffocation , and the toxic effect of radiation coming down to NN when this layer is destroyed or inhibited . Last NN , the NNS who were measuring the ozone layer VBD that it was weaker than ever ; it did not recover as was proposed after the Montreal Protocol . And they VBD out that , on the contrary , it is not only existing in the form of holes over the Antarctic and the Arctic – the latter CD existing only since Fukushima , as there was never a hole over the Arctic before . And now we have ozone depletion RB over the whole northern part of the NN . So , the toxic radiation is not only occurring at the poles but generally it comes down and it is destroying a lot of plants and lower animal NN , IN insects . With the insects dying , the birds and the whole food chain is affected by the weakness of the ozone layer , and in the oceans the plankton is dying and the krill that the JJ fish are eating . You have now JJ fish who are dying from hunger and you have dying coral reefs IN , for example , the Great Barrier Reef east of NNP Zealand , the biggest NN in the NN , which is now dying , and it is almost not reproducing itself anymore . NNS VBP it is because the oceans are VBG up , but this can not be the real reason . text: The JJ NN does not easily grasp the explosive nature of exponential growth . This was demonstrated more than 40 NNS ago in a series of pioneering psychological experiments conducted in the Netherlands by Willem Wagenaar and his colleagues . In CD NN , participants were shown a hypothetical index of air pollution beginning in 1970 at a low value of 3 and rising yearly in an exponential NN to 7 , 20 , 55 and , finally , 148 by 1974 . Asked to intuitively predict the index value for 1979 , JJ of the respondents produced estimates at or below CD percent of the correct value of about 21,000 ( which can be determined from the underlying exponential equation ) . Subsequent experiments have observed similarly dramatic underestimation of exponential growth and showed that it typically results from straight - line projections VBN on early JJ increases . The deceptive nature of exponential growth is similarly conveyed by the riddle of a single lily pad in a pond . Suppose each member of this NN reproduces once a day so that on the second day there are CD lily pads , on the third day there are four , on the fourth day there are eight , etc . On Day 48 , the pond is covered completely . How RB did it take to be covered halfway ? The answer is 47 days . Moreover , RB after 40 days of exponential growth , you MD barely VB the lily pads are there , as they MD cover only 1/256th ( 0.4 percent ) of the pond at that NN . For a period of NN , we can easily ignore the steady exponential growth of lily pads — until they smother the pond . As a result , in the past few weeks , the numbers have quickly become a torrent overwhelming our capacity to stop the NN ’ spread and care for the victims . It took 67 days to reach 100,000 NN NNS worldwide . The second 100,000 NNS took 11 days , and the third 100,000 took only four days . JJ - NN authorities are now scrambling to communicate just how steep and damaging the NN growth curve has or MD become , and urgent response is becoming the law of the land . Aside from the NN NN , the biggest , most destructive exponential growth processes that we must grapple with today are those associated with JJ NN NN . While it might be hard for NNS to detect that NN NNS and their concentration in the atmosphere are growing exponentially RB now , that does n’t mean we should rest easy . The opposite is JJ . As with the NN , we VBP to anticipate the NN NN and act quickly and aggressively to minimize further damages before they overwhelm us . NNS have RB recognized that NN dioxide NNS and their resulting effects have been increasing exponentially . text: Researchers at the NNP of Adelaide have VBN that a lake on an island off the coast of Queensland , Australia , has been relatively untouched by NNS in NN for the past 7000 NNS , and has so far RB resisted the impact of NNS . Blue Lake , CD of the largest lakes on North Stradbroke Island , southeast of Brisbane , has been the focus of research examining the lake ’s response to JJ NN over NN . Researchers studied the lake ’s NN discharge , NN quality and comparisons of historical photos over the past 117 NNS , as well as fossil pollen and algae to better understand its history over the past 7500 NNS . The results , published RB in the journal Freshwater Biology , show that Blue Lake has remained relatively stable and resilient for millennia . “ Blue Lake is CD of those rare , beautiful lakes in Australia . It ’s unusual because it ’s more than CD metres deep but it ’s so clear you can VB to the bottom , ” VBZ the lead author of the NN , Dr Cameron Barr from the NNP ’s Discipline of Geography , Environment and Population . “ We did n’t realize just how unique and unusual this lake is until we started looking at a wide range of JJ markers . “ We VBP that there have been variations in NN in the region including North Stradbroke Island over recent decades , but during that NN the depth , shoreline and NN chemistry of Blue Lake has displayed little variation . “ We RB VBP that the region experienced a significant shift towards a drier NN IN 4000 NNS ago . Again , Blue Lake has demonstrated little variation over this period . This is in stark contrast to other NNS in the region due to shifts in NN . “ It appears that Blue Lake has been an important NN ‘ refuge ’ for the freshwater biota of the region , and is in the same condition now as it was 7500 NNS ago . With appropriate management , the lake MD continue relatively unchanged for hundreds , possibly thousands of NNS to come , ” Dr Barr VBZ . Project leader and co-author Dr John Tibby , RB from the NNP of Adelaide , VBZ the results of this research MD affect decision making about utilising the freshwater aquifer of North Stradbroke Island as a source of fresh NN for the mainland . “ Our NN suggests that increased extraction of ground NN represents CD of the few obvious threats to the stability of Blue Lake . The threat this MD pose to the lake ’s status as a stable freshwater refuge needs serious consideration if the regional aquifer of North Stradbroke Island is to be contemplated , ” Dr Tibby VBZ . Wikimedia Commons Blue Lake on North Stadbroke Island in Australia has been untouched by NN or NN NN for the past 7,500 NNS , NNS VBP . THE ISLAND THAT’S CD OF NN ’S MOST IMPORTANT WETLANDS North Stradbroke Island lies 18 NNS off the coast of Brisbane – and its lakes are classed as CD of the NN ’s most ecologically important wetlands . As well as Blue Lake , the waterways include Brown Lake , the Keyholes , Eighteen Mile Swamp and some JJ lagoons . The Aboriginal name for Blue Lake National Park is ‘ Kaboora ’ , which means ‘ silent pool ’ . A haven for wildlife , the area attracts forest birds , goannas ( a type of monitor lizard ) and other reptiles . Blue Lake is RB home to soft - spined sunfish . The lake is not accessible by car , and the nearest car park is 1.5 NNS away .
