text: This article addresses the concept of climatic variation and NN within the set of integrated natural features and processes VBN as the NNP NN . The nature of the NN for NN NN is explained , as are the principal mechanisms that have caused NN NN throughout the history of NNP . Finally , a detailed description is given of NN NN over JJ JJ timescales , ranging from a typical JJ NN span to all of geologic NN . For a detailed description of the development of NNP ’s atmosphere , VB the article atmosphere , evolution of . For full treatment of the most critical issue of NN NN in the contemporary NN , VB JJ NN . NN is often defined loosely as the average NN at a particular place , incorporating such features as NN , precipitation , humidity , and windiness . A more specific definition MD VB that NN is the mean NN and variability of these features over some extended NN period . Both definitions acknowledge that the NN is always changing , owing to instabilities in the atmosphere . And as NN varies from day to day , so too does NN vary , from daily day - and - night cycles up to periods of geologic NN hundreds of millions of NNS RB . In a very real sense , NN variation is a redundant expression — NN is always varying . No CD NNS are exactly alike , nor are any CD decades , any CD centuries , or any CD millennia . The atmosphere is a dynamic fluid that is continually in motion . Both its physical properties and its rate and direction of motion are influenced by a variety of factors , including solar radiation , the geographic position of continents , ocean currents , the location and orientation of mountain ranges , atmospheric chemistry , and vegetation growing on the land NN . All these factors VBP through NN . Some factors , such as the distribution of heat within the oceans , atmospheric chemistry , and NN vegetation , VB at very short timescales . Others , such as the position of continents and the location and height of mountain ranges , VBP over very JJ timescales . Therefore , NN , which results from the physical properties and motion of the atmosphere , varies at every conceivable timescale . In 1938 the Grinnell Glacier filled the entire area at the bottom of the image . By 2006 it had largely disappeared from this view . NN NN , periodic modification of NNP ’s NN brought about as a result of NNS in the atmosphere as well as interactions between the atmosphere and various other geologic , chemical , biological , and geographic factors within the NNP NN . The atmosphere is influenced by and linked to other features of NNP , including oceans , NN masses ( glaciers and NN NN ) , land surfaces , and vegetation . Together , they make up an integrated NNP NN , in which all components interact with and influence CD another in often complex ways . For instance , NN influences the distribution of vegetation on NNP ’s NN ( e.g. , deserts exist in arid regions , forests in humid regions ) , but vegetation in turn influences NN by reflecting radiant NN back into the atmosphere , transferring NN ( and latent heat ) from soil to the atmosphere , and influencing the horizontal movement of air across the land NN . • None iceberg Tourist boat in front of a massive iceberg near the coast of Greenland . • None Turkmenistan Drought - resistant plants grow in the Repetek Preserve in the southeastern Karakum Desert , Turkmenistan . NNP NNS and atmospheric NNS are still seeking a full understanding of the complex feedbacks and interactions among the various components of the NNP NN . This effort is being facilitated by the development of an interdisciplinary NN called NNP NN NN . NN NN NN is composed of a wide range of disciplines , including climatology ( the NN of the atmosphere ) , geology ( the NN of NNP ’s NN and underground processes ) , ecology ( the NN of how NNP ’s organisms relate to CD another and their environment ) , oceanography ( the NN of NNP ’s oceans ) , glaciology ( the NN of NNP ’s NN masses ) , and RB the JJ sciences ( the NN of JJ behaviour in its JJ and cultural aspects ) . A full understanding of the NNP NN requires NN of how the NN and its components have changed through NN . The pursuit of this understanding has led to development of NNP NN history , an interdisciplinary NN that includes not only the contributions of NNP NN NNS but RB paleontologists ( who VBP the NN of past geologic periods ) , paleoclimatologists ( who VBP past climates ) , paleoecologists ( who VBP past environments and ecosystems ) , paleoceanographers ( who VBP the history of the oceans ) , and other NNS concerned with NNP history . Because JJ components of the NNP NN VBP at JJ rates and are relevant at JJ timescales , NNP NN history is a diverse and complex NN . These experiments provide opportunities to learn the relative influences of and interactions between various components of the NNP NN . Studies of NNP NN history RB specify the full array of NNS the NN has experienced in the past and those the NN is capable of experiencing in the future . Undoubtedly , NNS have always been aware of climatic variation at the relatively short timescales of seasons , NNS , and decades . Biblical scripture and other early documents refer to droughts , floods , periods of severe cold , and other climatic events . Nevertheless , a full appreciation of the nature and magnitude of climatic NN did not come about until the late 18th and early 19th centuries , a NN when the widespread recognition of the deep antiquity of NNP occurred . Naturalists of this NN , including Scottish geologist Charles Lyell , Swiss - born naturalist and geologist Louis Agassiz , English naturalist Charles Darwin , JJ botanist Asa Gray , and Welsh naturalist Alfred Russel Wallace , came to recognize geologic and biogeographic NN that made sense only in the light of past climates radically JJ from those prevailing today . Geologists and paleontologists in the 19th and early 20th centuries uncovered NN of massive climatic NNS taking place before the Pleistocene — that is , before some 2.6 CD NNS ago . text: A recent NPR broadcast documents the unveiling of the depopulation / taxation scheme as envisioned by Travis Rieder , a “ philosopher ” with the Berman Institute of Bioethics at Johns Hopkins NNP , who claims that not having NNS is a “ moral duty . ” Now , the JJ elitists are beginning to publicly play their hand by introducing the concept of taxing childbirth . In short , they have disguised their JJ depopulation scheme as being a necessary NN in the effort to fight NN NN . “ Here ’s a provocative thought : Maybe we should protect our kids by not having them , ” VBZ Rieder . Provocative indeed , but the scheme ( at least in its JJ stage ) is being candy - coated to make it sound more palatable to the average citizen . The depopulation birth tax MD apply more heavily to the rich , while encouraging the poor to use more birth NN , according to Rieder and his colleagues , who VBP that the plan will not be as “ abusive ” as NNP ’s CD - NN policy . “ It aims to persuade NNS to choose fewer NNS with a strategy that boils down to carrots for the poor , sticks for the rich . “ Ethically , Rieder VBZ poor nations VBP some slack because they ’re still developing , and because their per capita NNS are a sliver of the developed NN ’s . Plus , it just does n’t look good for rich , Western nations to tell NNS in poor ones not to have kids . ” Of course , the rich can afford a “ childbirth tax , ” while the rest of us non-elites will be the ones forced to abandon having NNS to comply with the depopulation scheme . Rieder claims that by reducing worldwide childbirth rates by “ half a NN per woman , ” NN NNS MD be reduced by as much as CD - quarter of the amount needed to avoid the “ tipping point ” that will lead to 4 degrees Celsius JJ NN by the end of the century – a level of NN that will ostensibly make the NN “ largely uninhabitable for NNS . ” His plan has created plenty of controversy already ; Rieder receives “ nasty comments ” RB , and has raised the ire of NN NN skeptics such as Marc Morano of NNP Depot . “ The warmists have now graduated from regulating our light bulbs , coal plants and SUVs to regulating our family size , ” VBD Morano . “ Let ’s keep ‘ JJ NN ’ out of the bedroom ! ” As radical as Rieder ’s proposals MD sound , there are those among the NN NN activists who are calling for RB more drastic measures . According to the Sierra Club : “ Childbearing [ should be ] a punishable crime against society , unless the NNS hold a NN license . ” RB more extreme is the stance of the Voluntary NNP Extinction Movement , whose members maintain that “ voluntary JJ extinction is the humanitarian alternative to JJ disasters , ” and that NNS should commit “ NN suicide ” to save the environment . The hidden agenda is no longer hidden And so it appears that the gloves are now off , as the JJ elites have begun to VB JJ with their depopulation plans . These self - appointed saviors apparently envision a NN in which they alone will enjoy the benefits of a reduced population , while the rabble are encouraged – or outright coerced – into non-reproduction . Who gave them the NN to make these decisions ? The answer is that we did – or at least JJ of us did – by allowing ourselves to be duped by fearmongers IN NNP Gore and others bent on selling the so that the elite MD take over the NN and fashion it into something that serves their interests . We VBP to understand that the issue is not NN NN at all ; the real agenda is creating a NN where you and I and our NNS ’s NNS will no longer be allowed to exist . Our very is now being threatened by the JJ elite – if we let them carry out their plans .

text: On the lakefront campus of the NNP of Wisconsin in Madison , which in 60 NNS MD have average NNS resembling those felt currently in Kansas City nearly 500 NNS to its south , the next wave of aspiring doctors settles in for a “ NN NN and Medicine ” elective filled to capacity . Students at Wisconsin learn under Dr. Jonathan Patz , who had already been consulting for the NNP Nations on accelerating man-made NN NN ’s NN impacts decades ago . The students examine , for instance , heat - related mortality , as well as the healthy “ upside ” of adapting to the effects of NN NN . Reducing PRP ’s reliance on cars and eating smarter benefits the JJ body and Mother NNP alike , Patz argues . Wisconsin is just CD of roughly CD dozen JJ schools leading — although only typically by offering a few courses — in the training of physicians , nurses , pharmacists and other practitioners who will take to the front lines of diagnosing and treating the impact of NN NN . That impact is showing up increasingly in emergencies , such as wildfires , and in complicated - pregnancy statistics RB in developed nations . More broadly , the spread of toxins , asthma NNS , cardiovascular NN and Lyme NN is on the rise , all part of what The Lancet has deemed the biggest JJ NN threat of the 21st century . Yet the slow drip of JJ or amended JJ - school programs that address NN NN must be accelerated , some experts stress . Their efforts got an important boost after the NNP NNP Association in 2019 gave its backing to expanding NN - NN training . “ NN NN is our reality . It is VBG to VB the NN we provide clinical care . For that reason , it needs to be taught in every JJ school across the nation , ” VBD Dr. Ashish Jha , the K.T. Li Professor of NNP NNP and NNP Policy at Harvard ’s T.H. Chan School of NNP NNP , writing in the Journal of the NNP NNP Association . So far , NN - related scholarship has emerged in the last few NNS via elective courses and CD - off lectures rather than treated as a portion of core curriculum , according to a NN published in 2018 in the journal Academic Medicine . Those researchers VBD that a database was created but is lacking comprehensive reporting by schools of what NN - NN lessons are taught . The lingering challenge : JJ schools VBP they can’t devote significant attention to NN NN in an already packed curriculum . The NN burden MD be eased via shared materials . Columbia NNP ’s Mailman School of NNP NNP formed the NNP Consortium on NNP and NNP Education in 2017 to begin to share ideas on how to train NN professionals . To date , it can count some 180 signatories of mostly JJ - NN programs , but RB over 20 JJ schools and another CD dozen nursing programs . For instance , an asthma - diagnosing exercise with questions more closely tied to pollution exposure has now been in practice at the NNP of Illinois College of Medicine at Urbana - Champaign and is driving curriculum priorities at the NNP of California , San Francisco , near where deadly fires raged over the last couple of NNS . For instance , it ’s important for JJ students to understand the effects that hotter NNS can have on the effectiveness and risks of pharmaceuticals , such as antipsychotics and diuretics , VBD UCSF ’s Dr. Sheri Weiser , an epidemiologist and practicing internist at Zuckerberg San Francisco General Hospital , who RB holds a master ’s degree in JJ NN . If the U.S. NN - care NN were a country , it MD rank 13th in the NN for NN gas NNS , the article in Academic Medicine cites . Dr. Karla Ivankovich , Ph.D. , a licensed clinical professional counselor and professor of psychology at the NNP of Illinois at Springfield , VBD the mental - NN profession has seen growing JJ anxiety from a widening trench of partisanship carry over into NN - VB dread , and JJ therapists MD welcome additional training . text: The White NNP laid out its policy priorities for a second NNP term yesterday , and NN NN was n’t on the agenda . In fact , the word “ NN ” did n’t appear at all in the 138 - page main budget document , which asked Congress for a total of $ 4.8 trillion to fund the NN ’s priorities across the federal NN in fiscal 2021 . That figure MD mean a slight increase in federal spending overall compared with the status quo and MD enable the NNP administration to grow the NN to include the U.S. NNP Force and to fund favorite infrastructure projects IN the border wall . But the agencies that are most responsible for addressing NN NN at home and abroad — including EPA and the departments of NNP and NNP — MD VB steep cuts under the proposal . And programs within those agencies that deal directly with NN NN MD take the biggest hit . Congress , however , is almost certain to reject the budget blueprint as is . For CD thing , it violates a bipartisan agreement on spending that Congress reached last summer . In addition — RB before Democrats gained NN of the NNP — Congress routinely MD override NNP ’s efforts to slash funding for NN - related items such as EPA grants to NNS and DOE ’s Advanced Research Projects Agency - NNP , a research and development program . And this NN Congress is likely to finish funding the federal NN after November ’s presidential NN . The result likely will weigh heavily on the appropriations process . But the budget document does provide a sneak peek of what NNP MD VB to do with a second term , including an extension to the 2017 tax cuts and continued efforts toward deregulation . And it includes his reelection pitch to voters — insomuch that it argues that his pro-business policies have resulted in a “ blue - collar ” JJ boom that has benefited workers , especially those in the NN sector . In the budget proposal , as in last week ’s NN of the Union address , NNP celebrated the NNP NNPS ’ arrival as a major oil and gas producer that ’s set in 2020 to be a net petroleum exporter . The shift began under NNP Obama , but NNP claimed credit for himself and his deregulatory policies . “ More jobs , lower costs , and JJ dominance — these are predictable results of our pro-energy policies , ” NNP wrote in his budget request . EPA , which is celebrating half a century of existence this NN , MD receive $ 6.7 CD for fiscal 2021 — a 27 % cut compared with enacted levels . It RB MD slash its workforce by about 11 % , to the lowest levels since 1985 . The administration stressed in the budget and its supporting documents that this NN MD return EPA to its “ core mission ” of protecting “ clean air , land and NN , and ensuring chemical safety , while targeting emerging domestic and JJ JJ challenges . ” It ’s unclear whether the last part of that line is a veiled reference to NN NN , but the issue is n’t mentioned by name in the EPA section of the main budget document . In an informal summary provided by EPA , it appears six times — mainly in the titles of programs slated for elimination . EPA tangled with California last NN over the NN ’s struggle to comply with the National Ambient Air Quality Standards . The budget asks Congress for a total of $ 437 CD for EPA ’s air quality work overall , down from the current funding level of $ 813 CD . That includes reduced budgets for enforcement , NN and technology , and other programs . The air and NN research program , which supports future regulations , MD lose CD - thirds of its budget — a sign that EPA under NNP is n’t contemplating JJ JJ regulatory actions . The budget request RB MD cut funding to implement the Montreal Protocol , a globally popular ozone treaty that ’s now RB phasing down hydrofluorocarbons — a powerful class of NN gases VBN in cooling and refrigeration . While there ’s scant mention of NN NN in EPA ’s budget , the issue does appear in a section on “ wasteful " spending items at EPA that the NNP administration has recommended for the chopping block . The budget again proposes moving the NNP Star NN efficiency program — which is jointly administered by EPA and DOE — to a user - fee model that Congress previously has rejected . The same section RB floated plans to zero out funding for several EPA NN NN partnership programs including the Coalbed Methane Outreach Program , the NNP Methane Initiative and Natural Gas STAR . “ These programs are not essential to EPA ’s core mission and can be implemented by the private sector , ” it VBZ . Sean Alcorn , a legislative analyst with the Natural Resources Defense Council , VBD the proposal to cut full - NN EPA staff from 14,172 positions to 12,610 MD VB rid of expertise at the agency — a move that MD pay dividends for NNP ’s anti-regulatory agenda RB if he does n’t win in November . “ This is trying to eviscerate the NN store that we have for future administrations , ” he VBD . “ It ’s setting EPA up to fail in future NNS . ” The fiscal 2021 budget justification for the NNP Department includes CD fleeting reference to NN NN as an issue , IN armed conflict and poverty , that is best solved through multilateral channels . But the NNP administration again proposes steep cuts to the top diplomatic agency of more than 21 % to $ 40.8 CD , down from $ 53 CD enacted for fiscal 2020 . The scope of the cuts is difficult to gauge because the proposal eliminates some budget lines and combines others . But observers VBP the result MD be deep reductions in U.S. support for multilateral and bilateral partnerships on the environment , renewable NN , NN , sustainable landscapes , forestry and other issues . Capitol Hill generally has rejected those moves and seems likely to do so again . In the last CD NNS , Congress has rejected NNP administration efforts to halve support for the JJ Environment Facility , which funds projects in developing NNS . The NNP NNPS remains a top contributor to the fund despite efforts by the NNP administration to zero out funding for fiscal 2020 . “ I VBP the message to the vulnerable NNS that VBP support from the GEF and from other funds is to pay attention to what gets into the final appropriations NN and not what is VBN in these requests , because they are messaging documents , ” VBD Joe Thwaites , who follows NN finance for the NNP Resources Institute . But funding for the NNP Nations ’ high - profile Green NNP Fund is unlikely to be restored while NNP is in office . The fund has been a target for GOP lawmakers who have resisted NNP ’s suggested cuts to other diplomatic budget lines . NNP ’s budget request proposes major cuts to disaster - response agencies such as the Federal Emergency Management Agency and the Army Corps of Engineers . But Congress previously has overridden similar proposals . A cut of $ 1.7 CD in Army Corps funding , to $ 6 CD next NN , MD reduce the agency ’s spending on flood NN — but that is unlikely to be sustained . The administration wants to eliminate funding “ for projects that are better suited to be carried out by NNS and local communities . ” But Congress has given the Army Corps more NN than administrations have requested since at least 2006 and has funneled increasing amounts in the past three NNS as intense flooding has damaged levees , according to the Congressional Research Service . The administration is renewing its effort to eliminate a $ CD CD FEMA program , enacted in the final month of the Obama administration , that helps communities pay for repairs to “ high - hazard ” dams whose failure MD result in loss of NN . Such projects are “ better suited to be carried out by NNS and local communities , ” the administration VBZ in its budget proposal . Congress repeatedly has restored the funding . The administration RB is trying again to cut FEMA ’s flood - mapping budget to $ 100 CD from $ 263 CD , saying that mapping the nation ’s floodplains “ is not solely a federal responsibility . ” Congress has blocked each attempted budget cut . The administration MD find agreement with Congress in overhauling a much - maligned disaster recovery program administered by the Department of Housing and Urban Development . Congress has given HUD $ 40 CD in emergency funding since 2017 to VB communities rebuild from major disasters such as Hurricanes Harvey , Irma and Maria in 2017 . But funding has been mired in huge delays because federal law requires HUD to undertake a JJ and detailed rulemaking process before it can release the NN . Congressional leaders from both parties — as well as advocates — are looking to revamp HUD ’s disaster - recovery program so NN can be allocated more quickly . The administration VBZ in its budget proposal that it “ seeks to work with the Congress to comprehensively reform and redesign ” the HUD program , which it calls “ slow , unpredictable , and wasteful . ” The administration wants to eliminate funding for a NNP program that is developing an observatory to monitor NNP to better understand NN NN . NNP ’s NNP Absolute Radiance and Refractivity Observatory MD produce “ highly accurate and trusted NN records ” that can VB produce policies on mitigation and NN “ that address the effects of NN NN on society , ” NNP VBZ . The observatory is scheduled to launch in 2023 . The administration acknowledges the observatory “ MD provide additional capabilities over existing satellites ” but VBZ the project “ is a lower priority compared to other NNP programs . ” The administration ’s budget boosts funding for missions to land astronauts on the NN and Mars . The NNP Department MD VB a cut of 8 % compared with 2020 enacted levels , to $ 38.5 CD . DOE ’s Advanced Research Projects Agency - NNP is again proposed for elimination , but Congress previously has shown no willingness to kill the popular research and development program . The Interior Department MD VB its budget reduced 13 % for fiscal 2021 , to $ 12.8 CD . NNP Democrats have accused the NNP administration of withholding funds from the U.S. Geological Survey ’s NNP NNP NNP Centers at Interior , which operate as partnerships with universities . Rep. Betty McCollum ( D - Minn. ) , chairwoman of the Interior and Environment Appropriations Subcommittee , pressed the matter during testimony from USGS Director James Reilly . Reilly claimed ignorance during the April hearing . Afterward , documents obtained through the Freedom of NNP Act showed NNP administration staffers were working to heed McCollum ’s warning . “ Congress will pay attention to the implementation of this funding , ” according to a June meeting agenda for high - level staffers of USGS , Interior ’s assistant secretary for NN and NN , and the Bureau of Reclamation . text: Meeting in Brussels for a CD - day gathering , EU heads of NN and NN will seek to hammer out a VBN NN strategy aimed at diversifying sources while reducing pollution . In the run-up to the meeting , EU leaders have cranked up the rhetoric about the NN for tough NN to tackle JJ NN , although some environmentalists VBP that proposed targets do not VB far enough . German Chancellor Angela Merkel , who will host European leaders for the JJ NN under Germany 's EU presidency , stressed the urgency of their task by warning that Europe was at an " important crossroads . " " If we act decisively now , we have a chance of effectively counteracting the dangers of NN NN , " she VBD in her invitation to the summit . Merkel VBD the British Financial Times newspaper on Wednesday that she wanted " Europe to take a ' pioneering lead ' on meaningful green initiatives . " Merkel was seconded by JJ US Vice NNP , NNP Gore who recently picked up an Oscar for his documentary on the ravages of JJ NN . Speaking to reporters on a visit to Brussels to address a conference on biofuels , Gore VBD a European lead on the issue was vital . " I 'm trying to VB my country to VB its policies , but in the meantime the European Union is absolutely key to helping the NN make the NN it must , " he VBD . British Prime Minister Tony Blair VBD that Europe should not only show leadership on combating NN NN , but RB beef up the security of NN supplies while opening the NN to more competition . " I VBP there is the real possibility of showing how Europe can lead the debate on NN NN , on NN security , and on deregulation in the interest of a more competitive European economy , " Blair VBD on Tuesday in London . EU leaders are expected to endorse plans to cut NN dioxide ( CO2 ) NNS by 20 percent by 2020 , from 1990 levels , and by 30 percent if other developed and emerging economies , particularly NNP and India , join them . The European Union produces about 14 percent of the NN 's NN gas NNS while the NNP NNPS , the NN 's largest polluter , produces some 25 percent . Although the summit is expected to provide a show of unity , tensions are brewing under the NN over the role of nuclear NN and the use of renewable NN sources . CD of the liveliest debates is expected on whether to set a binding target of renewable NN sources meeting 20 percent of Europe 's NN needs by 2020 , after foreign ministers failed to reach an agreement on Monday . Environmentalists : " It 's not enough " Although Europe is leading efforts to combat NN NN , some environmentalists warned that the EU leaders are not aiming high enough . " The EU 's NN NN plan ... will fall a JJ NN short in making Europe 's NN more sustainable unless targets for both renewable share and reducing NN gases are raised and tightened , " VBD Friends of the NNP NN campaigner Jan Kowalzig . NN policy has climbed to the top of the EU JJ agenda over the last NN as oil NN spikes and cuts in gas and oil supplies from NNP have spurred the bloc to forge a common strategy to meeting their needs . However , despite the growing importance attached to NN , the EU has struggled to hammer out a common approach , with member NNS often putting national interests RB , much to the frustration of the European Commission . Such is the NN with a European Commission idea to inject greater competition into the EU NN NN with plans to make JJ , integrated gas and NN NNS split their generating and distribution networks . Leaders are likely to send the plan back to the drawing board with France and to a lesser extent Germany opposed to the idea , which MD VB a major shake - up of French and German NN groups . The summit comes amid a shifting European JJ landscape with Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi emerging shaken from a recent NN , British Prime Minister Tony Blair increasingly a lame duck , and looming French presidential elections in April and NNP . It will RB be French NNP Jacques Chirac 's last chance to leave his mark on EU policy - making after nearly 12 NNS in office fiercely defending French interests during meetings with EU leaders . Looking ahead as Germany chairs the Group of Eight industrial nations this NN , Merkel will likely VB to take the conclusions of this week 's meetings into the G8 summit in Heiligendamm , Germany in June .

text: With rising seas and more frequent , intense storms on the horizon , what does NNP NNP City ’s future hold ? What do we VB to put in place now to insure it ? text: The NN must sharply draw down NN gas NNS and suck billions of tonnes of NN dioxide from the air if today 's youth are to be spared NN cataclysm , a top scientist has warned . " This reality is being ignored by governments IN the NN , " VBD James Hansen , who famously announced to the US Congress 30 NNS ago that JJ NN was underway . " To VB that we are ' moving in the JJ direction ' just is n't good enough anymore , " he VBD in an interview . Head of NNP 's Goddard Institute for NNP Studies until 2013 , Hansen and his 18 - NN - old granddaughter -- who is suing the US NN for contributing to the problem -- delivered that message this week at UN NN negotiations in Bonn . Thousands of diplomats at the 12 - day , 196 - nation talks are haggling over the fine print of a " user 's manual " for a treaty that will VB into effect in 2020 . Inked in the French capital in 2015 , the Paris Agreement calls for capping JJ NN at CD degrees Celsius ( 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit ) . With the NN out of kilter after only CD degree of NN -- enough to amplify deadly heatwaves , superstorms and droughts -- the treaty RB vows to explore the feasibility of holding the line at 1.5 C . " That is a good impulse , because if we VBP to 2 C , it is guaranteed that we will lose our shorelines and coastal cities , " VBD Hansen . " The only question is how fast . " NNP 's NN NN , the amount of CO2 in the atmosphere , and NN levels have all changed in lock - step over hundreds of millions of NNS , he pointed out . In CD , atmospheric concentration of NN dioxide -- the main NN gas -- tipped over 403 parts per CD ( ppm ) , 40 percent above the pre-industrial average and the highest level in at least 800,000 NNS , the UN's NN agency reported this week . RB under optimistic scenarios , that number is projected to rise for decades . The UN's NN advisory body , the Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP ( IPCC ) , has VBN we can " likely " stay under the 2 C threshold if CO2 levels do n't exceed 450 ppm by 2100 . For Hansen , that 's a recipe for disaster . Meltwater from the Greenland and Antarctic NN sheets MD add metres to NN levels by 2100 , he has calculated . " The last NN in NNP 's history that CO2 concentrations were at 450 ppm , NN level was 25 metres ( 80 NNS ) higher , " he noted . When writer and environmentalist NNP McKibben decided a decade ago to launch a campaign to fight JJ NN , he asked the NN 's best VBN NN scientist what he should call it . " He had in NN the name ' 450.org ' , " Hansen recalled . By coincidence , Hansen was about to publish a major NN that concluded the ceiling for CO2 levels should be 350 ppm , at most . Thus was born 350.org , probably the largest grassroots NN NN organisation in the NN . " Hansen does make a compelling NN that JJ NN NN impacts are occurring sooner and with greater magnitude than we expected , " VBD Michael Mann , director of the NNP NNP NNP Center at Pennsylvania NNP NNP . " Jim 's past predictions have proven prescient and we do indeed ignore him at our peril . " " Hansen 's contributions to the basic NN of NN NN are fundamental to our current understanding -- no NN has contributed more , " VBD Michael Oppenheimer , a professor of geosciences and international affairs at Princeton NNP . RB if humanity succeeds in bending down the curve of NN NNS far sooner than currently seems imaginable , it MD not be fast enough to bring CO2 levels back to 350 ppm by century 's end , according to Hansen . " You MD have to extract 150 CD tonnes of NN from the atmosphere , " more than CD times the amount we emit each NN , he VBD . The technology to do that does not currently exist . At 76 , Hansen is thinking a lot about and what kind of NN young NNS will be inheriting . So is his granddaughter , Sophie Kivlehan , a JJ NN NN student in the NNP NNPS . Along with 20 of her peers , Kivlehan has sued the US federal NN for what might best be called NN negligence . " When the US Constitution VBZ ' We the NNPS , ' that means young NNS too , " she VBD in an interview . " We have constitutional rights , and those rights are being violated . " The NN is currently wending its NN through the federal NN NN , and MD CD day wind up before the Supreme NNP , CD of the lawyers representing the plaintiffs VBD AFP . NN attempts to have the NN thrown out have failed . Despite his grim predictions , Hansen has not thrown his hands up in despair . He continues , for example , to campaign for a direct tax on fossil fuels as the only realistic NN to achieve the necessary cuts .

text: In honor of Rolling Stone ’s NNP NNP Issue , we asked artists to contribute messages about what they , their governments , and everyday NNS can do to stand up to the threat of NN NN . From England to Jamaica to the NNP NNPS , we are hearing from artists and activists IN the NN about what we can do locally , globally , and everywhere in between . When Annie Leonard , executive director of Greenpeace USA , talks about NN NN , she RB talks about community . “ My neighbors and I have a very , very strong sense of community . And that MD sound corny . ‘ What does that have to do with NN NN ? ’ But a strong community is VBG to VB us VB through NN NN , ” she explains . Building community not only allows for NNS to share fossil - fuel burdens with the NNS IN them , Leonard argues that it ’s necessary in order to band together for solutions , and build resilience to the effects of a changing NN . text: The NN on NNP has been changing since it formed 4.5 CD NNS ago . Until recently , natural factors have been the NN of these NNS . Natural influences on the NN include volcanic eruptions , NNS in the orbit of the NNP , and shifts in the NNP 's crust ( VBN as plate tectonics ) . Over the past CD CD NNS , the NNP has experienced a series of NN - ages ( ' glacial periods ' ) and warmer periods ( ' interglacial ' ) . Glacial and interglacial periods cycle roughly every 100,000 NNS , caused by NNS in NNP 's orbit IN the NN . For the past few thousand NNS , NNP has been in an interglacial period with a constant NN . However , since the Industrial Revolution in the 1800s , the JJ NN has increased at a much faster rate . By burning fossil fuels and changing how we use the land , JJ activity has quickly become the leading NN of NNS to our NN . How does the NN NN work ? Some gases in the NNP 's atmosphere trap heat and stop it escaping into NN . We call these ' NN gases ' . These gases act as a VBG blanket IN the NNP , VBN as the ' NN effect ' . NN gases come from both JJ and natural sources . Gases IN NN dioxide , methane , and nitrous oxide naturally occur in the atmosphere . Others , such as chlorofluorocarbons ( CFCs ) , are only produced by JJ activity . When short - wave radiation from the NN reaches NNP , most of it passes straight through and hits the NN . The NNP absorbs most of this radiation and gives off longer - wavelength infrared radiation . The NN gases absorb some of this infrared radiation , instead of it passing straight out into NN . The atmosphere then emits radiation in all directions , sending some of it back to the NN , causing the NN to heat up . This process is VBN as the ' NN effect ' . The NN effect is critical to our survival . In fact , without NN gases , NNP MD be about 30 degrees colder than it is today . Without NN gases and their NN effect , we MD n't be able to survive . However , since the Industrial Revolution , we 've been adding more and more NN gases into the air , trapping RB more heat . Instead of keeping NNP at a warm , stable NN , the NN effect is heating the NN at a much faster rate . We call this the ' enhanced NN effect ' and it's the main NN of NN NN . NNS VBP NN NN by releasing NN dioxide and other NN gases into the air . Today , there is more NN dioxide in the atmosphere than there ever has been in at least the past 800,000 NNS . During the 20th and 21st century , the level of NN dioxide rose by 40 % . We produce NN gases in lots of JJ ways : • Burning fossil fuels – Fossil fuels such as oil , gas , and coal contain NN dioxide that has been ' locked away ' in the ground for thousands of NNS . When we take these out of the land and burn them , we release the stored NN dioxide into the air . • Deforestation – Forests remove and store NN dioxide from the atmosphere . Cutting them down means that NN dioxide builds up quicker since there are no trees to absorb it . Not only that , trees release the NN they stored when we burn them . • Agriculture – Planting crops and rearing animals releases JJ JJ types of NN gases into the air . For example , animals produce methane , which is 30 times more powerful than NN dioxide as a NN gas . The nitrous oxide VBN for fertilisers is ten times worse and is nearly 300 times more potent than NN dioxide ! • Cement – Producing cement is another contributor to NN NN , causing 2 % of our entire NN dioxide NNS . Natural NNS to the NN The leading NN of NN NN is JJ activity and the release of NN gases . However , there are lots of natural causes that RB lead to NNS in the NN NN . Natural cycles can VB the NN to alternate between NN and cooling . There are RB natural factors that force the NN to VB , VBN as ' forcings ' . These NNS , called Milankovitch cycles , affect the amount of sunlight that falls on NNP . This can VB the NN of NNP to VB . However , these cycles take place over tens or hundreds of thousands of NNS and are unlikely to be causing the NNS to the NN that we are seeing today . • El Niño Southern Oscillation ( ENSO ) – ENSO is a pattern of changing NN NNS in the Pacific Ocean . In an ' El Niño ' NN , the JJ NN warms up , and in a ' La Niña ' NN , it cools down . These patterns can affect the JJ NN for a short amount of NN ( months or NNS ) but cannot explain the persistent NN that we VBP today . What is El Niño , what does it mean and how does it affect NN IN the NN ? Natural forcings that can contribute to NN NN include : • Solar irradiance – Changing NN from the NN has affected the NN of NNP in the past . However , we have not seen anything strong enough to VB our NN . Any increase in solar NN MD make the entire atmosphere of NNP warm , but we can only VB NN in the bottom layer . • Volcanic eruptions – Volcanoes have a mixed effect on our NN . Eruptions produce aerosol particles that cool NNP , but they RB release NN dioxide , which warms it . Volcanoes produce 50 times less NN dioxide than NNS do , so we VBP they are not the leading NN of JJ NN . On top of this , cooling is the dominant effect of volcanic eruptions , not NN . When looking at all the NN , there is a JJ scientific consensus that NNS are the leading NN of NN NN . In their latest report , the Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP stated with over 95 % certainty that JJ activity is the main NN of JJ NN . Natural NN cycles can VB the NN of NNP , but the NNS we are seeing are happening at a scale and speed that natural cycles cannot explain . These cycles affect the JJ NN for NNS , or sometimes just months , not the 100 NNS that we have observed . Meanwhile , longer - term NNS IN Milankovitch cycles and solar irradiance take thousands and thousands of NNS . There are lots of things that affect NN NN , but the NN is irrefutable . JJ activity , such as burning fossil fuels and changing how we use the land , is the leading NN of NN NN .

text: peculiar theme park in the Hague celebrates the history of the Netherlands through a series of miniature models . The Madurodam features little canals , old - fashioned windmills , tiny tulips and , amid it all , an homage to Royal Dutch Shell , the oil giant that is the biggest NN in the country and , by revenue , the second largest publicly traded oil - and - gas NN in the NN . There ’s a Shell drilling platform , a Shell gas station and a Shell natural - gas field , complete with a drilling rig . The display is at once odd–energy infrastructure in a NNS ’s theme park–and entirely fitting : Shell has been , for decades , CD of the most powerful players both in Dutch politics and on the JJ JJ stage . But that MD soon VB . As concerns grow over the existential challenges posed by NN NN , Shell must grapple with its own existential NN : How should a NN that generates most of its profits by serving the NN ’s enormous appetite for oil navigate a JJ - term future in which shifting JJ and JJ tides threaten to make fossil fuels obsolete ? The pressure to abandon oil and gas is already in force . In recent NNS , protesters have swarmed Shell ’s headquarters ; advocates representing 17,000 Dutch citizens have sued the NN ; and powerful investors successfully coerced executives to VB they will reduce NNS . In 2015 , NNS IN the NN promised to aggressively tackle NN - gas NNS , in order to meet the target laid out by the Paris Agreement : goals that require buying and burning significantly less oil and gas . Shell CEO Ben van Beurden has a bird ’s - eye view of the situation from his corner office at the NN ’s JJ headquarters in the Hague . “ We have to figure out what are the JJ bets to take in a NN that is completely changing because of society ’s concerns IN NN NN , ” he VBZ . Projections from NN NNS show demand for oil MD peak and fall in the coming decades ; some outside analyses suggest demand for oil MD plateau as soon as 2025 . Markets are already jittery about the industry : NN was the worst - performing sector on the S&P 500 index in 2019 . In 1980 , the NN industry represented 28 % of the index ’s value , according to the Institute for NNP Economics and Financial Analysis ( IEEFA ) . Last NN , it represented less than 5 % . The shift away from oil looms so JJ that Moody ’s warned in 2018 that the NN transition represents “ significant business and credit NN ” for oil NNS . The heads of the Banks of England and France VBD in an op - ed that any NN that does not VB strategically to the JJ NN reality “ will fail to exist . ” On Jan. 14 , Larry Fink , founder and CEO of investment giant BlackRock , wrote in an open letter that “ NN NN has become a defining factor in NNS ’ JJ - term prospects . ” As oil flirts with the prospect of decline , NN executives are at odds over what to do . Some firms , IN ExxonMobil , are positioning themselves to squeeze the last lucrative NNS from the oil economy while arguing to shareholders that they will be able to sell all their oil . Shell and a handful of others are beginning to adapt . Under van Beurden ’s leadership , Shell is charting a path that will allow it to continue to profit from oil and gas while simultaneously expanding its plastics business and diversifying into electrical NN . By the 2030s , the 112 - NN - old fossil - fuel giant wants to become the NN ’s largest NN NN . As part of this strategy , Shell has worked to present itself as environmentally friendly . Last NN , it committed to reduce its NNS by as much as 3 % by 2021 , and by RB 50 % by 2050 , tying its executives ’ compensation to the cuts . Shell ’s moves earned some applause among environmentalists , but the Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP , the U.N. ’s NN - NN body , concluded in 2018 that to keep NNS from rising to levels that MD bring a wide range of catastrophes , NNS must halve their NN - gas NNS by 2030 and hit net - zero NNS by 2050 . That MD mean more than incrementally reducing NNS ; it means keeping vast reserves of oil already discovered in the ground . Van Beurden ’s strategic response shows that NNS of JJ and JJ pressure–especially from governments and investors responding to a sustained JJ outcry–can push RB the most powerful interests to VB . Whether NN activists can harness this mounting pressure to compel Shell and other oil NNS to transform the JJ NN economy MD be the weightiest question of our NN . Executives at Shell knew decades ago that burning fossil fuels MD VB the NN to warm , and that once NN NN became a JJ issue , their firm MD VB to VB . Last NN , I sat down with van Beurden for a wide - ranging interview and asked him how he felt about “ Shell knew , ” the activist mantra that accuses the NN of failing to act on NN NN despite knowing the consequences . He was sanguine : “ Yeah , we knew . Everybody knew , ” he VBD . “ And somehow we all ignored it . ” In the 1990s , he explained , Shell publicly acknowledged NN NN and VBD the NN needed to act to combat the problem . But at the NN , neither governments nor consumers seemed too concerned about NNS , and the demand for oil was growing IN gangbusters to fuel a JJ JJ expansion . So the NN dutifully responded to NN demands : it produced and sold oil to turn a profit . Nearly three decades later , Shell ’s business model is shifting by the same NN - driven calculus . Despite advertising that depicts the oil giant as environmentally friendly , its decision to reduce reliance on oil is not born of benevolence . It ’s reacting to NN forces . A 2019 McKinsey report predicts that declining gas consumption in the transport sector , because of factors IN fuel efficiency and electrification , MD lead oil demand to begin decreasing in the early 2030s . “ The future of NN needs to evolve as something else , ” van Beurden VBZ . “ And we find a role for ourselves in it . ” The shift away from oil is not just a macroeconomic calculation . In 2018 , NNP NNP 100+ , a powerful group of JJ investors that now represents $ 41 trillion in assets , delivered an ultimatum : either Shell committed to short - term NNS - reduction targets , or it risked losing the support of some of its largest shareholders . While NNP NNP 100 + held little formal NN over Shell , the investors MD wreak havoc within the NN by opposing management in shareholder votes , a process where shareholders can force management to take specific actions . In an extreme NN , the investors MD ditch their Shell NN –which MD undermine share prices , tank the NN ’s valuation and drag down executive pay . “ Politics might be pretty confused and babbling at the moment , ” VBZ Anne Simpson , director of JJ governance at CalPERS , the largest JJ pension fund in the U.S. , and a steering - committee member at NNP NNP 100 + . “ But NN talks . ” Meanwhile , a Dutch - led group of investors VBN as Follow This actually went ahead with a series of activist shareholder resolutions that , if they had garnered the support of 75 % of shareholders , MD have required the NN to take aggressive NN NN . While the resolutions failed , the threat was real . By December 2018 , Shell relented and , a few months later , made the commitment to reducing NNS as much as 3 % by 2021 . Significantly , the commitment included end - use NNS : the NN was agreeing to take responsibility not only for its own operations , but RB for how consumers use Shell ’s NNS . The activist investors claimed victory . “ The only reason Shell has made this leap forward is because investors started supporting our resolution , ” Follow This founder Mark van Baal VBD me . Shell ’s JJ commitment was part of a broader rebranding effort . For decades , Shell and other oil - and - gas NNS portrayed themselves to consumers as essential to modern NN . Their NNS VBP your car and warm your NN . But over the NNS , that image has soured . The 2010 BP oil spill and a series of journalistic exposés of the industry ’s misbehavior stole headlines . Shell faced reports of corruption in Nigeria , where it has significant drilling operations , including its alleged complicity in NN JJ - rights abuses . Organizers VBP that in September 2019 , more than 7 CD NNS marched IN the globe , skipping school and work to demand that their governments take NN to reduce NN - gas NNS . The U.K. declared a NN emergency and prominent members of the U.S. Congress called to eliminate the country ’s fossil - fuel NNS by 2030 . In July , the head of OPEC , the oil cartel that in 2018 accounted for more than 40 % of the NN ’s crude - oil production , called NN activists “ the greatest threat to our industry . ” Widespread JJ criticism of NNP Oil is perhaps especially damaging to Shell . Unlike JJ of its competitors , Shell purchases much of its oil from other NNS , then slaps the Shell brand on it , rather than digging the stuff out of the ground itself . That means that its consumer reputation matters more than , VB , Occidental Petroleum’s . Shell RB faces scrutiny as a Netherlands - VBN NN . While U.S. firms IN ExxonMobil contend with a relatively conservative JJ environment in Texas , Shell is headquartered in the Hague , a city where you ’re more likely to VB hit by a bicycle than a car . In Amsterdam , 40,000 NNS took to the streets last spring to demand NN on NN NN , and some protesters carried signs with a version of the Shell logo fashioned into a middle finger . In London , protesters demonstrated outside Shell ’s offices , graffitiing the walls with slogans IN crime scene and Shell kills . “ Their own NN is built on the death and destruction of nature and of NNS all IN the NN , ” VBZ Farhana Yamin , a lawyer turned activist who glued herself to the cement outside Shell ’s London headquarters last April . The National Theatre in London dropped Shell as a sponsor in October , just as it declared a “ NN emergency , ” and the Dutch branch of Friends of the NNP is suing Shell for reneging on its “ duty of care ” obligation under Dutch law . “ All of these initiatives add to the pressure , ” VBZ Freek Bersch , a campaigner at Friends of the NNP Netherlands . Van Beurden certainly feels the heat . In recent regulatory filings Shell listed its “ societal licence to operate , ” industry lingo for how society views the NN , among its key concerns . Shell executives now VBP “ to ask ourselves more questions than just , ‘ Hey , is this legal or not ? ' ” van Beurden VBZ . They have to consider how society sees their brand . To witness exactly how Shell is changing , I visited CD of its biggest ongoing investments : a chemical facility outside of Pittsburgh estimated to cost $ 6 CD . When it ’s completed , the nearly 400 - acre site will churn out more than a CD tons of polyethylene every NN , the base for a host of plastic NNS that MD become anything from packaging to toys to JJ devices to car parts . Activists describe the facility as an JJ nightmare . Studies have VBN plastic in tap NN , in food NNS , and in the bellies of NN birds and whales . And plastic production is a significant driver of NN NN . The chemical sector is responsible for 18 % of industrial NN - dioxide NNS , according to a 2018 report from the International NNP Agency . NNS are expected to grow 30 % by 2050 . But , for Shell , the investment is emblematic of its future business model . As the NN rethinks its business , it plans to expand in plastics . Shell ’s other JJ bet outside of oil is natural gas , which is RB controversial . When burned , natural gas produces less NN than oil or coal does , but it ’s still much more polluting than renewable sources , IN solar or wind . But Shell is all - in : in CD , the NN maneuvered a $ 53 CD takeover of BG Group , an oil - and - gas NN that focused on liquefied natural gas ( LNG ) , and CD NNS later Shell announced it MD fund a $ 31 CD LNG - export terminal in Canada along with other partners . Shell is widely VBN as CD of the NN ’s leading natural - gas producers . The NN argues that natural gas is necessary to back up clean - NN sources IN wind and solar and to feed growing demand for NN in the developing NN . The NN ’s least contentious area of NN is its investment in the NN sector , delivering electricity to homes and businesses . While the NN sector is widely seen as essential to reducing NNS , critics point out that it ’s a tiny portion of Shell ’s portfolio . Shell is now spending up to $ 2 CD a NN building out its capacity to supply electricity –just a sliver of its roughly $ 25 CD capital expenditure , which is predominantly spent exploring and drilling for oil . But Shell is rethinking its oil business , too , in recognition that its most expensive drilling ventures wo n’t work in the future if oil demand slows . In 2015 , it ended its effort to drill in the Arctic , and in 2017 it sold off billions of Canadian oil - sand assets . Meanwhile , Shell ’s total oil reserves have slowly declined compared with its competitors ’ . In December 2018 , ExxonMobil had more than 17 NNS of oil reserves stored , BP had nearly 15 and Chevron more than 11 , according to Bloomberg NN . Shell maintained only 81/2 NNS of reserves . Analysts VBP it ’s too early to tell whether Shell ’s strategy to reduce reliance on oil will pay off for shareholders in the JJ run . Last NN , Shell , while continuing to pay JJ dividends , bought back NN , helping maintain its share NN . The maneuver kept the NN ’s NN valuation roughly level , but it ’s hardly a workable JJ - term strategy . Across the sector , NNS “ have to figure out who they are in this changing NN , ” VBZ Tom Sanzillo , director of finance at the IEEFA . “ They are not the profit center that they VBD to be , and they probably never will be . ” The viability of sticking with oil , RB as major NN economies promise to move away , is uncertain . Both ExxonMobil and Chevron are staying the course , hoping to outlast their competitors . But Shell and others are moving to adapt . BP , for instance , has RB invested in natural gas and NN , while ConocoPhillips has prioritized “ short - cycle project times ” to VB it stay economically competitive . Occidental has dropped NN into a method of drilling that allows it to store CO2 in the ground , a bet that it can offset some of the regulatory costs of CO2 NNS within its own operations . So while Shell and others are taking steps in the JJ direction to reduce total NNS , they are still barreling into a catastrophically NN - changed future . “ Shell is doing a lot of the JJ things , ” VBZ a senior NN official , who asked to remain anonymous to speak freely . “ The question is : What award do you VB for being the best - painted deck chair on the Titanic ? ” Last spring , Shell announced that it was leaving NNP Fuel & Petrochemical Manufacturers , an influential oil - industry trade lobby . RB the Shell display at Madurodam , that strange miniature theme park in the Hague , has been condemned by activists . Basic JJ factors RB loom JJ . text: Few NNS MD choose to be marooned on a vast expanse of NN NN at the onset of Arctic winter , but this past fall Jessie Creamean was delighted to spend nine weeks aboard a vessel that had been deliberately frozen into an NN cap near the top of the NN . On Mondays , she wrapped herself in several layers , including a heavy - duty parka and bulky orange boots with superinsulated soles , and ventured into the polar darkness . Driving snowmobiles loaded with equipment , she and her fellow researchers , on alert for cracks and fissures , caravanned over the jagged NN of the NN . After setting up a tent as a partial shield against the wind and bitter cold , and wearing red-filtered headlamps to avoid disturbing light - sensitive microbes , the researchers VBD a battery - powered drill fitted with a spinning circular blade and a three - NN - JJ barrel to draw about CD dozen cores out of the NN . Outside the tent stood a guard armed with a rifle and a flare gun , scanning the horizon for approaching polar bears . Creamean , an atmospheric scientist at Colorado NNP NNP , is CD of more than 300 researchers participating in a wildly ambitious , eye - wateringly expensive yearlong expedition called MOSAiC , the Multidisciplinary drifting Observatory for the NNP of Arctic NNP . The observatory in question is the expedition ’s research vessel , a German icebreaker called the Polarstern , which set sail from Norway last September . When the Polarstern reached Arctic waters , the researchers chose an NN floe that they believed was thick and sturdy enough to last through the summer , then moored the ship to the floe and waited for the NN to freeze IN it . The Polarstern and its floe are now indeed drifting across the Arctic Ocean , and if all goes well , they will continue to do so until the expedition ends in September 2020 . But this is an Arctic their predecessors MD barely recognize — and that is precisely the point of the expedition . Over the past three decades , the extent of Arctic NN NN in September , at the end of the summer melt , has declined by 30 percent . Since 2002 , the record low for summer NN has been broken four times , and several other recent NNS have come close to setting JJ records . Because the Arctic plays such an important role in cooling the NN , MOSAiC ’s goal is to understand how the NN , atmosphere and ocean are interacting in a NN Arctic , and how those dynamics affect NN IN the globe . CD group of MOSAiC researchers is studying the currents that move seawater in and out of the Arctic , and how ocean NNS affect atmospheric conditions as well as the freezing and melting of NN . Some are studying the cracks and gaps that form in the NN as NNS warm . Others are gauging the levels of NN gases in the ocean and atmosphere . text: Progressive Rep. Alexandria Ocasio- Cortez will co-chair a panel advising Joe Biden on NN policy as the apparent Democratic nominee takes steps to unify the party , it was announced on Wednesday . Biden VBD that Ocasio - Cortez is on CD of the six policy panels in comments to Las Vegas CBS affiliate KLAS - TV on Tuesday , when the JJ vice NN was asked what he was doing to bring supporters of Sen. Bernie Sanders into the fold . " We 've made some NNS , we 've listened to the Bernie supporters and , you VBP , for example , we have congresswoman Ocasio - Cortez , she is on CD of the panels as well , " Biden VBD . " And so I VBP we 're VBG to have a very VBN party . " In a joint statement announcing participants of the six “ Unity Task Forces ” released by Biden and Sanders on Wednesday , Ocasio - Cortez is listed as a co-chair of the NN NN task force along with Biden endorser , JJ Secretary of NNP John Kerry . The JJ 2004 presidential candidate and senator notably created the Paris NNP Agreement struck between numerous NNS under the Obama administration . Ocasio - Cortez , who had endorsed Bernie Sanders months before he dropped out of the race in April , will be serving as Sanders ' representative on the committee convened by Biden dealing with NN policy , her spokeswoman VBD . " She made the decision with members of the NNP Justice community — and she will be fully accountable to them and the larger advocacy community during this process , " spokeswoman Lauren Hitt VBD in an email . Hitt VBD that Ocasio - Cortez , D - N.Y. , " believes the movement will only be successful if we continue to apply pressure both inside and outside the NN , " and added that " this is just CD element of the broader fight for just policies . ” Other notable names serving on that task force are healthcare co-chairs Rep. Pramila Jayapal , D - Wash . , and JJ Obama era Surgeon General Vivek Murthy , who has briefed Biden daily on the NN - CD NN . The Obama administration ’s Attorney General Eric Holder will serve on criminal justice , which is chaired by Rep. Bobby Scott , D - Va. , whose SAFE Justice Act Biden has RB championed on the campaign trail . The six task forces were created last month after Sanders formally dropped out of the race to ensure that Biden MD win over key coalitions of his progressive supporters as he mobilizes to beat NNP Donald NNP with a VBN Democratic front . The groups will meet ahead of the Democratic National Convention to shape policy for the convention platform committee and Biden ’s agenda . “ A NNP party is key to defeating Donald NNP this November and moving our country forward through an unprecedented NN . As we work toward our shared goal , it is especially critical that we not lose sight of the pressing issues facing Americans , ” Biden VBD in a statement Wednesday . Sanders echoed the sentiment , commending Biden “ for working together with my campaign to assemble a group of leading thinkers and activists who can and will unify our party in a transformational and progressive direction . " Sanders , I - Vt. , ended his campaign for the Democratic presidential nomination on April 8 , and at the NN the pledged to have significant influence over the party platform . Sanders went on to officially endorse Biden for NN less than a week later . Biden , in the Tuesday interview with KLAS , which was done over the internet amid the NN NN , referenced the Sanders ' endorsement . The JJ vice NN RB seemed to suggest that Sanders ' supporters MD have gotten the wrong idea about his positions during the campaign . " My message to all — and what they 're finding out now that the nomination process is de facto over , they 're finding out the positions I had on an awful lot of things were not accurately characterized and they 're feeling more comfortable with it , " Biden VBD . " But I 'm listening . I 'm here , I VBP them , and I hope they all will join us . " Since Sanders ’ departure from the race Biden has extended multiple olive branches to his supporters , adopting policies on healthcare and education and hashing out a deal that ensures Sanders ’ earned delegates are represented on the convention floor in August . Although Sanders suspended his campaign , he remains on the ballot in primaries . On Tuesday Biden easily defeated Sanders in the Nebraska Democratic primary , NBC NNP projected . The win padded Biden 's delegate count tally to 1,490 of the 1,991 needed to secure the nomination .

text: Migration pressures from conflict , religious persecution and JJ causes already VBP headaches in Europe and elsewhere , but now the UN has decided that NN NN MD be yet another reason not to repatriate a migrant . In the NNS to come , as NN NN continues to bear the blame for everything from bushfires , drought , hurricanes , biblical - style rainfall and RB record snowfall , we might just look back at a recent NNP Nations ruling as the tipping point for the greatest - ever JJ migration shift . For the UN has put the developed NN on notice , and let ’s be frank , it is those prosperous nations they are lecturing to that refugees will have a NN to be relocated to from their drought - stricken , NN - logged or hurricane - devastated home NNS if the conditions at home subject their JJ rights to a violation . What exactly constitutes NN NN in a legal sense here is anyone ’s guess , but that ’s not a problem for the UN to consider , as it has just kicked that particular can down the road for those nations besieged by NN migrants in , VB 2035 , to deal with . The judgement was made after the ( unsuccessful ) claim of Ioane Teitiota , a NN from the Pacific nation of Kiribati , a collection of 33 islands threatened by rising NN levels who had applied for protection in NNP Zealand in 2013 , claiming his and his family ’s lives were at NN . Mr Teitiota was already deported from NNP Zealand in 2015 . The NNP Zealand courts rejected his claim , and the UN JJ rights committee upheld its decision saying there was NN for Kiribati and the international community to take affirmative NN and relocate its population but – and there was a JJ ‘ but ’ – the future effects of NN NN evident in some NNS MD mean it MD be considered a violation of a migrant ’s JJ rights – thus illegal – to be returned home by a nation in which they were seeking to enter . This is the sort of ruling that gives leaders and policymakers in the nations of southern Europe in particular , as well as those further north , sleepless nights . Did someone VB “ build a wall ” ? They VBP decisions being made about far - away lands that will have a sledgehammer impact on their own NNS in the not - too - distant future . For JJ governments , it is hard enough determining who is and who is n’t a legitimate refugee claiming protection from religious , sexual or racial discrimination . Do NNS of drought – or is it NNS of flood – constitute a threat to someone ’s JJ rights ? Is the heavy rainfall on the coast of South NNP down to the effects of that regular menace El Nino , or something more JJ term happening on the polar NN caps ? While the NN in general – excuse us , Mr NNP – is starting to identify JJ of the modern JJ phenomena as the results of JJ NN , NNS RB now are still a little fuzzy about the particulars . And there are so JJ issues to consider . There are sinking islands , IN Kiribati and the Maldives , there are bushfires in Australia , there are summer heatwaves in Greece and unparalleled rainfall in northern England . There are targets , declarations , denunciations , forums , committees , NNS , politicians , religious leaders and RB Swedish teenagers all creating a massive incoherent clamour from which it is impossible to distill any CD distinct message , apart from “ we ’re all gonna die , ” which most of us VBP anyway . text: Charles Dickens was a British novelist , journalist , editor , illustrator and JJ commentator who wrote such beloved classic novels as Oliver Twist , A Christmas Carol , Nicholas Nickleby , David Copperfield , A Tale of NNP Cities and Great Expectations . Dickens is remembered as CD of the most important and influential writers of the 19th century . Among his accomplishments , he has been lauded for providing a stark portrait of the Victorian - era underclass , helping to bring about JJ NN . Dickens was born Charles John Huffam Dickens on February 7 , 1812 , in Portsmouth , on the southern coast of England . The famed British author was the second of eight NNS . His father , John Dickens , was a naval clerk who dreamed of striking it rich . Charles ' mother , Elizabeth Barrow , aspired to be a teacher and school director . Despite his NNS ’ best efforts , the family remained poor . Nevertheless , they were happy in the early days . In 1816 , they moved to Chatham , Kent , where young Dickens and his siblings were free to roam the countryside and explore the old castle at Rochester . In 1822 , the Dickens family moved to Camden Town , a poor neighborhood in London . By then the family ’s financial situation had grown dire , as John Dickens had a dangerous habit of living beyond the family ’s means . Eventually , John was sent to prison for debt in 1824 , when Charles was just 12 NNS old . Following his father ’s imprisonment , Dickens was forced to leave school to work at a boot - blacking factory alongside the River Thames . At the run-down , rodent - ridden factory , Dickens earned six shillings a week labeling pots of “ blacking , ” a substance VBN to clean fireplaces . It was the best he MD do to VB support his family . Looking back on the experience , Dickens saw it as the moment he VBD goodbye to his youthful innocence , stating that he wondered “ how [ he ] MD be so easily cast away at such a young age . ” He felt abandoned and betrayed by the adults who were supposed to take care of him . These sentiments MD later become a recurring theme in his writing . Much to his relief , Dickens was permitted to VB back to school when his father received a family inheritance and VBD it to pay off his debts . But when Dickens was 15 , his education was pulled out from under him once again . In 1827 , he had to drop out of school and work as an office boy to contribute to his family ’s income . As it turned out , the job became a launching point for his writing career . Within a NN of being hired , Dickens began freelance reporting at the law courts of London . Just a few NNS later , he was reporting for CD major London newspapers . In 1833 , he began submitting sketches to various magazines and newspapers under the pseudonym “ Boz . ” In 1836 , his clippings were published in his JJ book , Sketches by Boz . In the same NN , Dickens started publishing The Posthumous Papers of the Pickwick Club . His series , originally written as captions for artist Robert Seymour ’s humorous sports - themed illustrations , took the form of monthly serial installments . The Posthumous Papers of the Pickwick Club was wildly popular with readers . In fact , Dickens ’ captions were RB more popular than the illustrations they were meant to accompany . He later edited magazines including Household Words and All the NNP Round , the latter of which he founded . Dickens married Catherine Hogarth soon after his JJ book , Sketches by Boz , was published . The couple had a brood of CD NNS . During the 1850s , Dickens suffered CD devastating losses : the deaths of his daughter and father . He RB separated from his wife in 1858 . Dickens slandered Catherine publicly , and struck up an intimate relationship with a young actress named Ellen " Nelly " Ternan . Sources differ on whether the CD started seeing each other before or after Dickens ' marital separation ; it is RB believed that he went to great lengths to erase any documentation alluding to Ternan 's presence in his NN . Throughout his career , Dickens published a total of 15 novels . His most well - VBN works include : Oliver Twist , Dickens JJ novel , follows the NN of an orphan living in the streets . The book was inspired by how Dickens felt as an impoverished NN forced to VB by on his wits and earn his own keep . As publisher of a magazine called Bentley ’s Miscellany , Dickens began publishing Oliver Twist in installments between February 1837 and April 1838 , with the full book edition published in November 1838 . Dickens continued showcasing Oliver Twist in the magazines he later edited , including Household Words and All the NNP Round . The novel was extremely well - received in both England and NNP . Dedicated readers of Oliver Twist eagerly anticipated the next monthly installment . On December CD , 1843 , Dickens published A Christmas Carol . The book features the timeless protagonist Ebenezer Scrooge , a curmudgeonly old miser , who , with the NN of ghosts , finds the Christmas spirit . Dickens penned the book in just six weeks , beginning in October and finishing just in NN for the holiday celebrations . The novel was intended as a JJ criticism , to bring attention to the hardships faced by England ’s poorer classes . The book was a roaring success , selling more than 6,000 copies upon publication . Readers in England and NNP were touched by the book ’s empathetic emotional depth ; CD JJ entrepreneur reportedly gave his employees an extra day ’s holiday after reading it . Despite literary criticism , the book remains CD of Dickens ’ most well - VBN and beloved works . ' Dealings with the Firm of Dombey and Son ' ( 1846 to 1848 ) From October 1846 to April 1848 , Dickens published , in monthly installments , Dealings with the Firm of Dombey and Son . The novel , which was published in book form in 1848 , centers on the theme of how business tactics affect a family ’s personal finances . Taking a dark view of England , it is considered pivotal to Dickens ’ body of work in that it set the tone for his other novels . David Copperfield was the JJ work of its kind : No NN had ever written a novel that simply followed a character through his everyday NN . From NNP 1849 to November 1850 , Dickens published the book in monthly installations , with the full novel form published in November 1850 . In writing it , Dickens tapped into his own personal experiences , from his difficult childhood to his work as a journalist . Although David Copperfield is not considered Dickens ’ best work , it was his personal favorite . It RB helped define the NN ’s expectations of a Dickensian novel . Following the death of his father and daughter and separation from his wife , Dickens ’ novels began to express a darkened worldview . In Bleak NNP , published in installments from 1852 to 1853 , he deals with the hypocrisy of British society . It was considered his most complex novel to date . Hard Times takes place in an industrial town at the peak of JJ expansion . Published in 1854 , the book focuses on the shortcomings of employers as well as those who seek NN . Coming out of his “ dark novel ” period , in 1859 Dickens published A Tale of NNP Cities , a historical novel that takes place during the French Revolution in Paris and London . He published it in a periodical he founded , All the NNP Round . The story focuses on themes of the NN for sacrifice , the struggle between the evils inherent in oppression and revolution , and the possibility of resurrection and rebirth . Great Expectations , published in serial form between December 1860 to August 1861 and in novel form in October 1861 , is widely considered Dickens ’ greatest literary accomplishment . The story , Dickens ’ second to be narrated in the JJ person , focuses on the lifelong journey of moral development for the novel ’s protagonist , an orphan named Pip . With extreme imagery and colorful characters , the well - received novel ’s themes include wealth and poverty , love and rejection , and good versus evil . After the publication of Oliver Twist , Dickens struggled to match the level of its success . From 1838 to 1841 , he published The NNP and Adventures of Nicholas Nickleby , The Old Curiosity Shop and Barnaby Rudge . Another novel from Dickens ’ darker period is Little Dorrit ( 1857 ) , a fictional NN of how JJ values come in conflict with the NN ’s brutality . Dickens ’ novel Our Mutual Friend , published in serial form between 1864 to 1865 before being published as a book in 1865 , analyzes the psychological impact of wealth on London society . Travels to the NNP NNPS and Italy In 1842 , Dickens and his wife , Catherine , embarked on a five - month lecture tour of the NNP NNPS . Upon their return , Dickens penned NNP Notes for General Circulation , a sarcastic travelogue criticizing JJ culture and materialism . IN this NN he RB wrote The NNP and Adventures of Martin Chuzzlewit , a story about a NN ’s struggle to survive on the ruthless JJ frontier . During his JJ U.S. tour , in 1842 , Dickens spoke of his opposition to slavery and expressed his support for additional reform . His lectures , which began in Virginia and ended in Missouri , were so widely attended that ticket scalpers gathered outside his events . Biographer J.B. Priestley wrote that during the tour , Dickens enjoyed " the greatest welcome that probably any visitor to NNP has ever had . ” “ They flock IN me as if I were an idol , ” bragged Dickens , a VBN show - off . Although he enjoyed the attention at RB , he eventually resented the invasion of privacy . He was RB annoyed by what he viewed as Americans ’ gregariousness and crude habits , as he later expressed in NNP Notes . After his criticism of the JJ NNS during his JJ tour , Dickens launched a second U.S. tour , from 1867 to 1868 , hoping to set things RB with the NN . This NN , he made a charismatic speech promising to praise the NNP NNPS in reprints of NNP Notes for General Circulation and The NNP and Adventures of Martin Chuzzlewit . His 75 readings netted an estimated $ 95,000 , which , in the Victorian era , amounted to approximately $ 1.5 CD in current U.S. dollars . Back at home , Dickens had become so famous that NNS recognized him all over London as he strolled IN the city , collecting the observations that MD serve as inspiration for his future work . Dickens RB spent significant NN in Italy , resulting in his 1846 travelogue Pictures from Italy .
